name: Eviction Moratirorium for the City of Hayward
description:
Note: Hayward City Council voted to expand this moratorium to September 30, 2020. For information about Housing and the Residential Rent Stabilization Program please check our website at www.hayward-ca.gov/housing. Rent Review Kiosk: Hard copies of the Residential Rent Stabilization forms and materials are available for self-service on the first floor of City Hall. File a Petitions: Petition can be filed by mail, sent by email to housing@hayward-ca.gov, or dropped off at the Rent Review Kiosk drop box. File Notices: Rent increase notices and notices of termination of tenancy can be filed by mail, emailed to rentalnotifications@hayward-ca.gov or dropped off at the Rent Review Kiosk. Pay Rent Stabilization Fee: Rent Stabilization Fee can be paid by mail or online at https://haywardselfservice.us/hss/ Mailing Address: Housing Division 777 B Street, Fourth floor Hayward, Ca 94541 To view a list of departments with modified hours or services visit our website: www.hayward-ca.gov/covid-19. For your convenience, please see below for frequently asked questions and services.   COVID-19 Updates Make a Payment   Hayward Water Support   Pay a Traffic Ticket   Report an Abandoned Vehicle  Signup for AC Alert Subscribe to Public Safety emails   For all other questions or concerns, please utilize our Access Hayward system. Updated: 7-13-2020 9:58 am SMR. 

Provides a one-time rent relief grant directly to landlords on behalf of low-income tenants to reduce burden on tenants due to COVID. Helps offset corresponding lost revenue that landlords need to provide housing services. Ensure landlords receive the revenue needed to maintain housing services. Bay Area Community Services (BACS) will be administering the program on behalf of the City of Hayward.

name: Eviction Moratorium County of Alameda
description:
On Tuesday March 24, 2020 the Alameda County ​Board of Supervisors unanimously ​passed an emergency ordinancesuspending evictions in the Unincorporated County for renters and homeowners ​who are experiencing loss of income, significant out-of-pocket medical expenses or childcare needs as a result of the County COVID-19 shelter mandate.  The Ordinance took effect immediately upon passage and will be in effect until April 23, 2020 ​unless extended by the Board. 
Unincorporated County residents who are served a Notice of Termination ​while the ordinance is in effect ​will need to provide documentation of loss of income, substantial medical expenses or child care impacts.
Violators are subject to a $1000 fine per violation and may be subject to civil proceedings. 
​The ordinance and associated staff report are available here.

name: Eviction moratorium for residential renters, nonprofit organization renters, and small business renters of Oakland
description:
Note: On Tuesday, May 19, 2020, the Oakland City Council extended the eviction moratorium for residential renters, nonprofit organization renters, and small business renters (generally those with fewer than 100 employees) through August 31, 2020. Updated: 7-13-2020 9:07 a.m. SMR 

This moratorium will prohibit most evictions, effective immediately and continuing through August 31, 2020, unless the City Council extends that date. Additionally, the moratorium prohibits residential rent increases above 3.5% (the Consumer Price Index, or CPI) and prohibits any late fees related to COVID-19 issues in residential units. Unpaid rent will still be due, and the moratorium does not relieve tenants of the obligation to pay unpaid back rent in the future. The Ordinance also prohibits evictions based on nonpayment of rent that became due during the Local Emergency when the tenant suffered a substantial reduction of income or substantial increase of expenses due to COVID-19.

name: Eviction Moratorium- Union City
description: The eviction moratorium will last until May 31, or until the expiration of local or state emergency declarations, whichever is later. It will protect any residential or commercial tenant from being evicted for not paying their rent “where the failure to pay rent is from income loss resulting from the coronavirus.

name: Tenants Right Project
description:
Helps people fight unlawful evictions and rent increases and get relief from uninhabitable living conditions. Offers legal help for all aspects of the landlord-tenant relationship from the lease to the return of the deposit. Provides legal advice for tenants who have received an eviction notice. Provides advocacy for repairs and relief from uninhabitable housing. Drop-in Housing Law Clinics are offered Thursdays.

NOTE: All offices are closed but continue to take calls at general number 510-437-1554. Staff will return calls M-F, 9-5 PM. Also can email at info@centrolegal.org. Legal consultation provided over the phone but no longer at on-site clinics (until April 7).  Posted 3/24/2020, 12:46 PM, pg

name: Tenants Rights
description:
NOTE: OTU monthly meetings are suspended until further notice. For help, call or email. Posted: 4-29-2020 12:03pm SMR 

Helps low-wage workers fight unlawful working conditions. Provides legal help for wage claims, discrimination, and workers' compensation. Provides policy and advocacy regarding
  • tenant law issues
  • rent regulation law
  • condominium conversion
  • and just cause
  • Advice
  • Information and Referral
  • Legal Resources for Complex and Specific Questions
  • Community Resources for Housing Related Assistance

name: Tenants' Rights Clinic
description:
Note: To receive general tenant rights counseling during the COVID-19 outbreak we are switching our services to counseling over the phone. Call 415-487-9203, leave a voicemail with your name and a brief description of problem and you will receive a call back as soon as possible. Posted: 4-29-2020 11:41am SMR  

Provides free tenant counseling and case management. For low-income residents of Oakland through the Housing Committee/Tenants' Rights Clinic. Advise regarding general rights as a tenant, including:
  • problems with repairs
  • rent increases
  • evictions
  • harassment
  • other problems with tenancy
  • issues regarding fair housing and discrimination.

No legal advice is provided.

name: Aids/HIV Legal Referral Services
description:
Note: Program is following safety guidelines and asking if clients are sick to reschedule or have appointment done by phone or online.  Only assisting by appointments. Posted: 5-4-2020 12:46pm SMR 

Provides free and low-cost legal services, as well as advocacy in civil matters to people living with HIV/AIDS in the San Francisco Bay Area. Services include consultations about a client's legal rights as a person living with HIV/AIDS, referrals to over 700 qualified attorneys on the Panel. Offers direct representation by an ALRP staff attorney or qualified ALRP panel attorney.

name: Empowerment Center
description:
Assist domestic violence victims with immediate crisis intervention services such as; assistance obtaining shelter, emergency food, clothing and transportation, referral to and advocacy with other social services and resources, crisis counseling and support. The Center also offers ongoing case management services to help victims move toward self-sufficiency. Groups and workshops on financial literacy, legal issues, temporary restraining orders and other topics are available.

NOTE:
In response to COVID-19, at this time, our Empowerment Center is closed. Our business lines (510) 574-2250 are still receiving calls and will be handling as much of our normal business as we can remotely. Anyone needing emergency support due to domestic violence should call our hotline (510)794-6055. This line is staffed 24/7 and will be operating as it normally does.

Our Safe House is currently full and we will continue to shelter the residents through this crisis and beyond. Posted 3/24/2020, 3:20 PM, pg

name: Lawyer Referral Service
description:
Note: Hours have changed from 8:30-Noon. Visit website for further questions. Posted: 4-13-2020 10:30am SMR 

Refers callers to local attorneys who give legal advice and representation in major legal areas. Areas include:
  • Bankruptcy
  • Business law
  • Consumer law
  • Criminal defense
  • Estate planning, wills and trusts
  • Family law and divorce
  • Immigration
  • Labor relations and employment
  • Landlord-tenant disputes
  • Personal injury (including medical malpractice)
  • Probate
  • Real Estate
  • Taxation
  • Workers' compensation
Screens callers for type of legal problem and refers to an attorney with appropriate experience. Does not include attorneys who provide services for free. Refers callers to other agencies if referral to private attorney is not appropriate. Referral staff are not attorneys and will not give legal advice or opinions.

name: Legal and Paralegal Assistance
description:
Provides legal information and assistance in the areas of:
  • Family Law (divorce, child custody, child support)
  • Employment Law
  • Small Claims
Legal advice is given but representation is not available. Does not offer help filling out any forms for family law. Provides referrals to local attorneys and paralegals who handle various areas of law.

name: Consumer Health Plan Information and Education
organization_name: CALIFORNIA OFFICE OF THE PATIENT ADVOCATE (OPA)
description: To inform and educate consumers about rights and responsibilities as health plan enrollees and to teach how to make best use of the services offered by health plans. The OPA has three primary functions: Consumer Education, Public Reporting, and Collaboration which includes work with government and non government patient assistance programs to then make referrals and recommendations to the Department of Managed Health Care. The Help Center is available 7 days a week, 24 hours a day; toll free at 888-466-2219 or TDD 877-688-9891.

name: Health Care Legal Assistance
description:
Note: Offices are closed until further notice. Though their physical offices are closed, all of their staff are continuing to work and advocate for clients' rights.
Posted: 4-10-2020 2:40pm SMR 

Attorneys provide free legal assistance to individuals facing problems with:
  • Medi-Cal and Denti-Cal
  • Medicare
  • Healthy Families Program
  • In-Home Support Services
  • Paratransit Services
  • County Medically Indigent Programs
  • Mental Health Services,
  • Health Maintenance Organizations (HMOs) 
Call the Legal Advice Line for help with a health care issue including access to health care, or problems with unfair medical billing.

name: Community Legal Assistance Saturday Program (CLASP)
description:
Note: Program has been suspended until further notice. Posted: 4-13-2020 10:32am SMR 

Offers a monthly, free, drop-in legal clinic open to the public.

Volunteer attorneys meet with individuals for 15-20 minute consultations. Attorneys are experienced in many areas of law including:
  • Family law
  • Immigration law
  • Housing
  • Consumer rights
  • Employment
  • Personal injury
  • Probate
  • and more

name: Elder or Dependent Adult Abuse - Online Forms and Information
description:
Website provides information and forms for cases of Elder or Dependent Adult Abuse. Provides links to numerous resources including:
  • questions and answers about Elder Abuse
  • information on Conservatorship
Forms which can be completed on one's computer then printed include "Request for Orders to Stop Elder or Dependent Adult Abuse." Informational forms include "Can a Restraining Order to Prevent Elder or Dependent Adult Abuse Help Me?"

name: Families and Children - Online Information
description:
Website provides an introduction to Family Law and specific information and legal forms on the following:
  • divorce
  • legal separation
  • annulment
  • child custody and visitation
  • child
  • partner and spousal support
  • parentage and adoption (including stepparent and partner adoption)
  • juvenile delinquency (what happens if one's child is arrested)
  • emancipation
  • special education
  • guardianship

name: Self-Help Services and Family Law Facilitator
organization_name: SUPERIOR COURT OF CALIFORNIA- COUNTY OF ALAMEDA
description:
Note: Closed to the public. Limited staff is working on essential services. Response to emails and voicemails are taking a longer time to answer due to limited staff. Posted 4-13-2020 9:07am SMR
  • NOTE: Resumption of Court’s fax filing service for certain emergency-related Civil, Family, and Probate documents.
    o Expansion of documents that can be files at the Court’s drop box locations.
    o Drop box added for Probate documents at the Berkeley Courthouse.
  • Order deems April 6 through May 1, 2020, to be holidays for most purposes o During COVID-19 crisis, all appearances in civil actions and misdemeanor appeals must be by telephone or video technology, and (b) all pleadings (except for initial service of process) and all court notices be served electronically
  • All jury trials will be continued, and jurors will not be called o Any prospective jurors who received a summons with a date from April 6, 2020, through May 1, 2020, are not required to report for jury service and will be considered to have satisfied their jury service
  • Effective March 30, 2020, Court SelfHelp Center available to assist customers Monday – Thursday from 9:00am – 12:00pm via the web using LiveChat.  LiveChat can be found on bottom of right corner of the Court’s  Self-Help Center web site  
  • Effective March 30, 2020, Court Self Help Center available to schedule one-on-one video appointments.  Customers will be identified during LiveChat or telephonic sessions and scheduled accordingly  Posted: 4/23/2020, 12:29 PM, ar

Provides procedural information, referrals and assistance for litigants who do not have an attorney. The Center provide workshops, and information and assistance with: Family Law, Child Support, Custody/Visitation, Unlawful Detainers, Small Claims, General Civil Actions, Name Changes, Guardianships, Family Law Clinics - Spanish, Restraining Orders: Civil Harassment, Domestic Violence & Elder Abuse. PHONE HOURS are Monday-Thursday, 2-4pm. Calls and messages are accepted only when made between these hours. WALK-IN HOURS are Monday-Friday, 8:30-12.

name: Alameda County Workforce Development Board (ACWDB)
description:
Provides job seekers with access to tools, resources and services that assist them with obtaining their employment goals. These services are available throughout Alameda County through a Comprehensive One Stop Career Center (serving the Eden area in Hayward) and through workforce services networks that serve the Tri-Cities, North Cities, and Valley areas of Alameda County.

Offers RAPID RESPONSE services to Employers and Dislocated Workers when companies undergo downsizing, relocation, layoffs and closures. Provides information on: career planning, vocational retraining, and re-employment.

name: America's Job Center of California AJCC - Fremont (FRC Building))
organization_name: EASTBAY WORKS - ONE STOP CAREER CENTERS
description:
Notes: Office is closed to the public. Staff is working remotely to assist clients. Assistance provided via online. Posted: 4-14-2020 11:30am SMR

Center provides resources and services that are focused on assisting any member of the community with job search, training information and career assistance. A fully equipped resource center with reference materials, internet access, computers and laser printer, fax, copier and telephones.  Provides access to the California Employment Development Department's (EDD's) online CalJOBS program and access to filing for Unemployment Insurance on-line or call 800-300-5616.

name: College of Alameda (CalWORKs, Health Services, One-Stop Career Center) - (Serving Alameda, Albany, Berkeley, Emeryville & Piedmont)
description:
Note: Campus Is Closed Until Further Notice. Remote services are now available. Posted: 4-28-2020 4:06pm SMR 

College offers academic and career education, academic and career counseling, and other support services for students including:  ADMISSIONS & RECORDS: Contact 510-748-2228, Building A101. CalWORKs Program assists students with vocational and educational training programs that lead to self-sufficiency. Provides case management, resource referrals, financial aid assistance and employment services. Health Services offers health screenings, family planning, first aid, TB testing and confidential health counseling to students. For more information and appointments call 510-748-2320. NORTH CITIES CAREER CENTERS http://tinyurl.com/North-Cities located on the college campus, provides free employment services to students and community members. Walk in for orientation, call 510-748-2208 to confirm time. FINANCIAL AID: Contact College of Alameda financial aid office at 510-748-2392, or go to www.peralta.edu.

name: Eden Area AJCC (America's Job Center of California)
address: 555 Ralph Appezzato Memorial Parkway, Portable - P

description:
Notes: Office is closed to the public. Staff is working remotely to assist clients. Assistance provided via online. Posted: 4-14-2020 11:30am SMR

The Eden Area America's Job Center of California (AJCC) is a self-directed, no cost community employment resource center. The AJCC provides employment and training resources and services to assist job seekers with job search, training information and career planning. Serves both individuals seeking first, new or better jobs and employers seeking to hire new workers.

name: Eden Area One-Stop Career Center
organization_name: EDEN AREA AMERICA'S JOB CENTER OF CALIFORNIA (AJCC)
description:
Note: Closed until May 1st. Staff is available to answer questions. Posted: 4-16-2020 3:33pm SMR 

Provides full job search and career assistance. Offers workshops on job seeking, resume writing and interviewing skills. Clients have access to computer stations with word processing capability, databases, Microsoft Excel spreadsheets, the Internet, and resume and career resource software. Provides access to the California Employment Development Department's (EDD's) online CalJOBS program. Access to filing for Unemployment Insurance (UI) and State Disability Insurance (SDI) claims by phone, online or by mail.

name: Employment Services
description:
Notes: Office is closed to the public and staff is working remotely. Not helping apply for unemployment in person at the moment. VITA is innactive. Posted: 4-13-2020 4:29pm SMR 

Provides education, job skill training. and job placement to refugees, immigrants, and low-income individuals when training is completed. Also offers ESL (English as a second language) concurrent with training.

name: Job Coaching
description: Offers personal career coaching to advance your career or reach your job goals. All individuals can receive assistance with job search, resume building, computer classes and much more!

name: Job Placement Services
description:
Note: Office is closed to the public. Staff is working remotely but still offering limited services. Posted: 4-20-20 1:54pm SMR 

Provides an array of employment and training services in a convenient, easily accessible location. Offers job placement services to the community via a career advisor and a job developer that assists clients daily with resume creation, and job coaching.

name: Job Referral Assistance
description: Assists individuals with referrals to job opportunities. Agency has developed relationships with employers in the Tri-Cities area  who notify program when employees are needed. Also assists individuals interested in applying for In-Home Supportive Services (IHSS) and other public employment opportunities.

name: Oakland One-Stop Career Centers
description:
Notes: Closed to regular services until further notice. Staff is working remotely and checking voicemail and emails daily. Posted: 4-13-2020 3:22pm SMR 

PIC manages Oaklands Comprehensive One Stop Career Center (Oakland Career Center EASTBAY Works) at 268 Grand Avenue, Oakland on behalf of the Oakland Workforce Investment Board (WIB) and in partnership with the State of California Employment Development Department (EDD). The Career Center specializes in serving long-term unemployed, laid-off workers and re-entry individuals.  PIC also operates two career centers:
  1. SSA Eastmont Career Center located in the Eastmont Town Center at 7200 Bancroft Avenue Suite 140
  2. West Oakland Career Center at 1801 Adeline Street, Oakland. These centers specialize in serving CalWORKS and General Assistance recipients.

name: One Stop Shop (One-Stop Career Center/Transfer Center and Puente Program)
description: Provides career counseling and job search support. On-site computers with Internet access are available for job, career or college searching. Also offers resume templates, phone, duplicating and fax access for career and job purposes; offers resume critique by e-mail. Website provides information on job fairs, new and current job postings, and career and employment resources.Located in Room R-105.

name: One-Stop Career Center
description:
Notes: Office is closed until May 1st. Email or check online for available services. Posted 4-15-2020 10:48am SMR

 Provides a one-stop center for information about access to a wide array of job training, education, and employment services. Programs include:Vocational Assessment and TrainingCase ManagementJob Placement

name: TDRC
description: Offers employment, housing, vocational training, treatment services to individuals returning from custody or on probation, or pre-trial. Provides assistance in removing barriers and meeting court-ordered requirements.

name: The Lord Provides Resource Center
description: Assist the residents of the West Oakland community. Strives to place local people into local jobs and housing units by referrals. Is a self-help and one-stop career service center that offers a full staff, a computer lab, career counseling classes, tutoring, resume writing, counseling, case management, and job and housing search assistance.

name: Tri-Cities One-Stop Career Center (Serving Fremont, Newark & Union City)
organization_name: EASTBAY WORKS - ONE STOP CAREER CENTERS
description:
Notes: Office is closed to the public. Staff is working remotely to assist clients. Assistance provided via online. Posted: 4-14-2020 11:30am SMR

Offers resources to the general public for the purpose of seeking jobs, training, or education. Resources specifically for job seekers and more focused support for special populations in the community. Also offers business resources and services specifically for employers. There is no charge for any of our services. Provides access to the California Employment Development Department's (EDD's) online CalJOBS program and access to filing for Unemployment Insurance on-line or call 800-300-5616.

name: Tri-Valley One-Stop Career Center
organization_name: EASTBAY WORKS - ONE STOP CAREER CENTERS
description:
Notes: Office is closed to the public. Staff is working remotely to assist clients. Assistance provided via online. Posted: 4-14-2020 11:30am SMR

A publicly-funded resource for jobs, employment, education, training, and business development in the Pleasanton, Dublin, and Tri-Valley communities. For more information about services and programs, a weekly orientation is held every week (by appointment only). Services offered include job search workshops with instruction in job seeking, resume writing and interviewing skills. Offers weekly job clubs and networking opportunities, vocational, career and supportive counseling as well as classroom and on-the-job training. Resources include: job listings, library of career-related materials, job search videos, information on vocational schools and training, community resources, labor market, and employers. Access to the California Employment Development Department's (EDD's) CalJOBS program. Offers basic beginning computer assistance. Provides computer stations with word processing, database, spreadsheet, internet resumes and career resource software as well as fax machines, copiers and phones for employer contact. Also assists employers in finding employees by posting job opportunities.

name: Youth Employment Opportunity Program (YEOP)
organization_name: CALIFORNIA STATE EMPLOYMENT DEVELOPMENT DEPARTMENT - EDD
description:
Provides special services to youth age 15-25. Assists youth in achieving their educational and vocational goals. Services include:
  • peer advising
  • referrals to supportive services
  • workshops
  • job referrals
  • placement assistance
  • referrals to training and community outreach centers

name: 90-Day Job Rehabilitation, Recovery and Fundraising Program
description:
Note: Not accepting new clients until further notice. Posted: 4-13-2020 11:36am SMR 

90-day non-residential program with possibility of extension (90 more days). Offers job rehabilitation; breakfast, lunch and dinner, Tuesday-Saturday; and fundraising activities to maintain Emergency Shelter. Offers bus fare, transportation assistance and opportunities to do laundry. Holds AA and NA meetings. Mandatory church attendance on Sundays; clients do not have to be Christian but must attend.

name: Academic Advising and Career Education Center (AACE)
description:
One-stop center for both academic advising and career development assistance, and career services. Counselors guide students in understanding and completing all General Education and graduation requirements in addition to helping them clarify and attain their career goals. Services include:
  • Career Education
  • Major Exploration
  • Academic Advising
  • Resources for employers, students with disabilities,etc.

organization_name: ALAMEDA COUNTY BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CARE SERVICES (ACBHCS)
description:
Note: Due to many pharmacies being currently shuttered, and in case of the event of a prescribing emergency the pharmacy team and the Office of the Medical Director is available to assist in identifying alternate resources.  Please call 510-567-8106.

Note: Office is not open to the public. Call for more information. 
Posted 4-10-2020 3:19pm SMR

Provides Individual Placement and Support, Supported Employment to mental health consumers that have expressed an interest to work. Consumers are referred from Service Teams representing mental health clinics in Alameda County Behavioral Health Care Services (ACBHCS). Job Plans are based on the individual preferences of the consumer and include vocational counseling and outreach, competitive job search and retention, and ongoing collaboration with individuals team.

name: Administration Office / Hayward Community Resource Center
description:
Note: Program is currently full and not accepting clients. Call for more information.
Posted: 4-10-2020 3:35pm SMR

Provides multi-lingual, multicultural health and related services to low and moderate income families in Hayward, including health insurance assistance, counseling for mental and substance abuse issues, general case management and referral to social and health services, legal assistance, advocacy, information about food and shelter, education/prevention/safe exit regarding domestic violence and child abuse, job preparation, financial literacy, and support groups.

organization_name: ALAMEDA COUNTY SOCIAL SERVICES AGENCY WORKFORCE AND BENEFITS ADMINISTRATION
description:
Prepares Clients for possible employment through a variety of activities, including job club and job search. Employable General Assistance and/or CalFresh recipients are currently not required to participate in employment program for continued eligibility.
NOTE: Lobbies are Temporarily Closed to Help Prevent the Spread of COVID-19. The below Alameda County Social Services Agency office lobbies are currently closed. We will continue to provide essential services. Clients who are receiving or wish to apply for Medi-Cal, CalFresh, CalWORKs, Refugee Cash Assistance, and General Assistance may use available telephone, fax, mail, and online services. Applications, renewals, documents, and reports can be submitted for most programs online at www.MyBenefitsCalWIN.org. You may also submit information by fax at 510-670-5095 or by mail at P.O. Box 12941, Oakland, CA 94604.

During the temporary closure, limited in-person access will be available for the following:
  • Emergency Electronic Benefit Transfer (EBT) Card/ Benefits Identification Card (BIC) or check pick-up
  • Homeless mail pick-up
  • Cash Assistance Program for Immigrants (CAPI) Applications
  • Clients who do not have access to a telephone and need to comply with a required program interview
Applications will continue to be available at offices in designated areas for all benefit programs, and community members may complete, sign and return documents for processing using a secure drop box during regular business hours, 8:30 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. Application Forms With Links

organization_name: CALIFORNIA STATE SCHOOL FOR THE DEAF
description:
Program provides:
  • infant education
  • preschool education
  • elementary education
  • secondary and high school education
  • career and technical education
Continuing and community education is provided through local schools and adult education programs. The school is also a residential program and a resource center providing information and referral for the northern California area. Students from nearby communities attend on a day school-basis.

name: CalWORKs Program (LaneyWORKs)
description: Teaches, trains, counsels and helps CalWORKs students to facilitate transition from public assistance to employment and self-sufficiency. Provides case management, academic, career and personal counseling,  job readiness training and child care. Also offers referral assistance for financial aid, assistance with books and supplies, work-study and internships, and job search/placement assistance.

name: Career Advancement Programs; Pathways for Men and Women
description:
Note: Office is closed until shelter in place has been lifted. Still able to leave messages for staff. Posted: 4-16-2020 12:22pm SMR

Offers professional skills development, such as communication, goal-setting, and a network of support to help individuals create new opportunities for themselves, their families and their communities. Helps individuals work with each other and with top career coaches. They develop specific action plans for job retention and career advancement. PATHWAYS is a 6-session workshops designed to help participants learn what it takes to excel on the job. Includes conflict resolution, problem solving, teamwork and communication skills. Applications are accepted on a rolling basis. Workshops meet once a week for 2 hours, for 6 weeks.

name: Career Connect
description: Career Connect is a 7-week career exploration and preparation program for Oakland students Grades 6th-12th. Students will get a jump start on their career planning as they begin or continue to sharpen their skills through interactive learning activities. Exploration of career fields will broaden students’ knowledge while narrowing their career and college choices as they assess their skills, talents, and interests. Career and life skills will be built upon simultaneously.

name: Career Counseling Library
description:
Note: Currently offering program called Access technology resources for UC Berkeley students in need of technology resources. Can apply to access free laptops and WiFi while supplies last. Devices will be mailed to students who are unable to pick them up on campus.
  • Visit the link for more information and to submit a needs assessment form.
  • Phone #: 510-693-5647; email: jtbmcnulty@berkeley.edu

COLA Mutual Aid 
For anyone associated with the extended community within and surrounding UC Berkeley (undergraduates, students, workers, faculty, staff, non-affiliates in the East Bay or wider SF area) who are requesting financial assistance or other forms of aid during the COVID-19 pandemic. Responses to this form will remain anonymous except to the organizers and the volunteers or donors with whom you are paired for assistance.

  • Contact: rumur.dowling@gmail.com; angiesijunlou@gmail.com

Posted: 4-17-2020 1:29pm SMR 

Provides general information on all major career fields and helps students assess their interests, personality, values, and skills. Other services:
  • Explore career options
  • Help choose a major
  • Research graduate and professional schools.

name: Career Development and Prevention Center; Steps 2 Success (S-2-S) Program
description:
Prepares youth to enter the workforce that provide:
  • structured work readiness training
  • career planning and counseling activities
  • tuition for vocational training
  • job placement
  • transportation support for participants, age 16-24

S-2-S also provides:
LIFE SKILLS COUNSELING AND CASE MANAGEMENT: Day-to-day living skills that guide youth during their transition into adulthood.
TUTORIAL SUPPORT AND EXIT EXAM PREPARATION: Academic tutoring from UC Berkeley students and BYA staff.
COLLEGE ADMISSIONS AND FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE GUIDANCE:
  • Individual educational plans for post-secondary planning
  • financial aid workshops

Youth age 18 and under are eligible for paid internships in Landscape, Urban Gardening, and Sports and Health. Each internship lasts approximately 6 months.

description:
Note: Closed until further notice. Posted 4-10-2020 2:10pm SMR 

Assists homeless and extremely low-income adults to enter the workforce. The program is designed to systematically help participants address barriers to obtaining employment and receive training in key areas to develop workforce skills. After undergoing training, men and women are placed in temporary labor positions in painting, maintenance work, security and customer service.

name: Civicorps Corpsmember Academy
description: Offers a charter high school serving young adults 18-26 years old. Reinforces students' basic academic skills and teaches them tools and techniques for academic success. Through active research, students also develop a leadership agenda and improvement plan for communities. Students supplement field work by attending evening and Friday classes. Graduates earn a high school diploma.

College offers academic and career education, academic and career counseling, and other support services for students including:  ADMISSIONS & RECORDS: Contact 510-748-2228, Building A101. CalWORKs Program assists students with vocational and educational training programs that lead to self-sufficiency. Health Services offers health screenings, family planning, first aid, TB testing and confidential health counseling to students. organization_name: THE ARC OF THE EAST BAY
description:

Posted: 5-4-2020 9:27am SMR 

Provides job search, placement and training, as well as travel training for adults with intellectual and developmental disabilities. Assists in developing employment opportunities with businesses in the community, and matches individuals eager to work with those employers. Provides ongoing job coaching and support at no cost to the individual or company. Provides support such as mobility training to ensure the person can get to the work site, individualized job coaching, education about benefits and responsibilities of SSI/SSA recipients, and referral to independent living skills programs.

name: Downtown Streets Team
description: Homeless and at-risk Team members 18 and up, beautify Hayward through their work experience program. In return for their volunteer services, they recieve a basic needs stipend and access to Case management and employment services. An individual can get connected with DST by coming to their Weekly Success Meeting, every Tuesday. It is located at the Hayward Area Historical Society, located at 22380 Foothill Blvd, Hayward, CA 94541. The meeting is at 12:30 pm and typically lasts around an hour.

name: Eden Area One-Stop Career Center
organization_name: EDEN AREA AMERICA'S JOB CENTER OF CALIFORNIA (AJCC)
description:
Note: Closed until May 1st. Staff is available to answer questions. Posted: 4-16-2020 3:33pm SMR 

Provides full job search and career assistance. Offers workshops on job seeking, resume writing and interviewing skills. Clients have access to computer stations with word processing capability, databases, Microsoft Excel spreadsheets, the Internet, and resume and career resource software. Provides access to the California Employment Development Department's (EDD's) online CalJOBS program. Access to filing for Unemployment Insurance (UI) and State Disability Insurance (SDI) claims by phone, online or by mail.

name: Education and Support Services
description:
Provides peer support, mentoring, support for textbooks, and school enrollment assistance. Also offers referrals to on-campus support for formerly incarcerated college students. Other support services include:
  • Transportation
  • Referrals to supportive services agencies
  • Financial literacy
  • One-on-one intensive case management
  • Barrier removal to help meet educational goals
  • Referrals to vocational training 
  • High School Completion (Diploma, GED, HiSET)
  • Transition to college and financial aid supports
  • Career training education 
  • English as a second language (ESL)
  • Adult basic education 
  • Academic Counseling

name: Employment Programs
description: CAF operates a Work Activity Program (WAP). In collaboration with the Regional Center of East Bay and the California Department of Rehabilitation. The Work Activity Program is CARF (Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities) accredited. WAP has been providing individuals with vocational skills and paid work experience. This business division is called Custom Assembly and Packaging (CAP). CAP operates an on-site Assembly and Packaging business at CAF Richmond facility. Working with Custom Assembly and Packaging, individuals enrolled in the WAP program are employed by CAP. Provide packaging, labeling and assembly services for a variety of businesses that have contracted with CAP. Participants earn an income and are provided resources. Enables them to secure more mainstream employment. To augment the participants vocational training and developing employment skills, individuals are provided on-site adult education classes.

name: Employment Services
description:
Notes: Office is closed to the public and staff is working remotely. Not helping apply for unemployment in person at the moment. VITA is innactive. Posted: 4-13-2020 4:29pm SMR 

Provides education, job skill training. and job placement to refugees, immigrants, and low-income individuals when training is completed. Also offers ESL (English as a second language) concurrent with training.

name: Environmental Training Center
description: A youth employment program for youth age 16-24. Youth learn job and life skills through their participation and work on various crews. Services are coordinated with Counseling Center; group counseling sessions are required. Options include: URBAN GARDENING: Youth learn organic farming techniques, sustainable agriculture, and sales and marketing while creating a beautiful area within the community. Youth maintain a produce garden.

name: Food Service Training - Berkeley
description: Offers training that focuses on basic culinary, barista and customer service skills for jobs in cafs, restaurants and other food retail businesses. In addition, there is a strong job readiness component that includes resume writing, job search, interviewing, and other skills needed to transition into the food industry. TRAINEE REQUIREMENTS: Must love to cook and bake, be 18 years of age and older, low income, eligible to work in the U.S. or is in the process of getting a work permit, committed to finding a job in the food industry upon graduation, physically able to complete training, for example work on feet for 8 hours a day and lift 25 pounds, drug and alcohol free, free of violent or weapon-related offenses, able to read recipes in English, willing to receive follow-up calls from program staff after graduation. For application information call their training hotline and have a pen and paper 888-283-3522 or email at info@breadproject.org.

name: Foster Youth Job Readiness and Employment Referrals
description: Offers employment specialists to assist current and former foster youth and probation youth with all aspects of their job readiness and employment search. Staff helps youth explore vocational interests and options, locate job readiness resources and pursue employment opportunities.

name: Goodwill Academy
organization_name: GOODWILL INDUSTRIES OF THE GREATER EAST BAY INC
description: The Goodwill Academy is a vocational education program tailored to help those with very little work experience. The Program focuses on four major areas: work skills, career development, life skills, and support services. Provides hands-on work skills training at 28 stores and three plants, which enables participants to receive a paycheck while attending program. While attending this training, participants attend Goodwill Academy classes and receive individualized job and career services.

name: Kitchen of Champions Culinary Program
organization_name: SOCIETY OF ST. VINCENT DE PAUL OF ALAMEDA COUNTY
description:
Note: Closed until further notice. Posted 4-10-2020 2:10pm SMR 

Offers a hands-on culinary employment training program. The program helps prepare people for fair-wage positions in the food and hospitality industry. Provides classroom and hands-on training, workforce readiness basics, case management and job placement. Students in the training program get real-world practice, working under a master chef and helping prepare the meals served at the Dining Room.

name: Laney College (CalWORKs, Child Care, Health Services, Project Bridge)
description:
Note: Campus Is Closed Until Further Notice. Remote services are now available. Posted: 4-28-2020 4:06pm SMR 

Accredited California community college offers academic education, academic and career counseling, and other support services for diverse students of all ages. Offers associate degrees, certificate programs, career and technical education, and courses transferable to 4-year colleges and universities.  ADMISSIONS & RECORDS: Contact 510-464-3121, Monday-Friday, 8-4:30 or go to Room A109.  CalWORKs PROGRAM: Offers vocational and educational training programs that lead to self-sufficiency. Provides case management, resource referrals, financial aid assistance, employment services, and childcare assistance. Contact 510-986-6946 for more information.  CHILD CARE: Provides free, limited child-care services for pre-school children of qualified full-time students. For more information, contact 510-464-3574.  HEALTH SERVICES offers TB skin testing, stress management, first aid, health checks, weight checks, nutrition counseling, health insurance information, flu immunizations, and family planning. For additional information and appointments call 510-464-3516.  PROJECT BRIDGE provides programs for adults who want to strengthen basic skills in reading, writing, math, computer, and study skills. Contact 510-464-3411 for more information.  FINANCIAL AID INFORMATION: Contact 510-464-3414, e-mail inquiry to laneyfinaid@peralta.edu or go to www.peralta.edu.

name: Las Positas College CalWORKs Program
description:
Note: Campus is closed to the public. Available online. Posted: 5-1-2020 10:33am SMR 

The Las Positas College CalWORKs program serves CalWORKs students and their families. Provides educational and career opportunities. Offers an array of support services that enable CalWORKs students to:
  • complete their educational goals
  • find meaningful employment
  • transition into the workforce

name: Oakland Adult and Career Education Center
description:
Offers adult educational services such as:
  • GED courses 
  • ESL Family Literacy Program
  • ESL citizenship classes
  • ESL college and career readiness courses
  • Pre-apprenticeship math courses

name: Oakland Women's Center Supportive Services
description: Women's Centers International manages the Oakland Women's Center. Provides free training workshops in four core areas: Business Management and job skills, Adult Education( Literacy, ESL, GED), Health Education for women and response to sexual and domestic violence. They provide referrals for housing and any service that we do not yet directly provide. The center is a safe environment that fosters a cross-cultural sisterhood of support for low-income women who want to build more prosperous lives.

name: One Stop Shop (One-Stop Career Center/Transfer Center and Puente Program)
description: Provides career counseling and job search support. On-site computers with Internet access are available for job, career or college searching. Also offers resume templates, phone, duplicating and fax access for career and job purposes; offers resume critique by e-mail. Website provides information on job fairs, new and current job postings, and career and employment resources.Located in Room R-105.

name: One-Stop Career Center
description:
Notes: Office is closed until May 1st. Email or check online for available services. Posted 4-15-2020 10:48am SMR

 Provides a one-stop center for information about access to a wide array of job training, education, and employment services. Programs include:Vocational Assessment and TrainingCase ManagementJob Placement

name: Opportunity Build
description: A pre-apprenticeship training program that prepares unemployed and under-employed adults with barriers to employment for entry-level jobs in the construction, energy efficiency and solar industries and for union apprenticeships. GETS provides classroom and hands-on training / technical training. During the 9 to 11 weeks of training, participants learn basic construction skills, earn OSHA 10 and First Aid/CPR certifications, strengthen applied math skills and work on employment readiness. During and after classroom training, participants receive 12 months of case management and job placement support from GETS staff who help in identifying and securing employment and union apprenticeship opportunities.

name: Police Explorer Program
description:
Offers leadership programs to prepare students to be active in the community, learn more about law enforcement career, obtain valuable work experience, and take on more responsibility as a young adult. Basic volunteering includes:
  • Ride-Alongs
  • Traffic Control
  • Evidence Searches and more

name: Pre-College TRIO
description:
Note: Currently offering program called Access technology resources for UC Berkeley students in need of technology resources. Can apply to access free laptops and WiFi while supplies last. Devices will be mailed to students who are unable to pick them up on campus.
  • Visit the link for more information and to submit a needs assessment form.
  • Phone #: 510-693-5647; email: jtbmcnulty@berkeley.edu
  • More info:  Laptop and WiFi Hotspot Lending Program
COLA Mutual Aid 
For anyone associated with the extended community within and surrounding UC Berkeley (undergraduates, students, workers, faculty, staff, non-affiliates in the East Bay or wider SF area) who are requesting financial assistance or other forms of aid during the COVID-19 pandemic. Responses to this form will remain anonymous except to the organizers and the volunteers or donors with whom you are paired for assistance.
  • If you are in need of aid, please fill out this form: bit.ly/cal-mutualaid-requests
  • Contact: rumur.dowling@gmail.com; angiesijunlou@gmail.com
  • More info: bit.ly/cal-mutualaid-requests

Posted: 4-17-2020 1:29pm SMR 

Identify and assists individuals from disadvantaged backgrounds who have the potential to succeed in higher education. The program publicizes the availability of financial aid and assist participants with their postsecondary application process.
alternate_name: Center For Educational Partnerships - Talent Search Program

name: Pro Customer Service and Administrator Training
description: PRO graduates are suited to a wide variety of entry level jobs such as; customer service, administrator roles and retail, sales positions such as; cashier, office clerk, receptionist and telephone and customer service representative.

name: Refugee Employment Services
organization_name: CATHOLIC CHARITIES OF THE EAST BAY - CCEB
description:
Provides refugees with job search skills, employment counseling, job development, and job placement to help them effectively integrate into American life. Also assists with job retention. Vocational ESL provided at Oakland office. Services also provided in Spanish at Oakland office.

March 11, 2020

Dear Members of our Community:
As the news of the coronavirus (COVID-19) continues to evolve, we at Catholic Charities East Bay are making efforts to protect the health of our staff and of our community.
We are therefore cancelling all walk-in consultation and housing clinics through the end of March.
Individual appointments and other business operations will continue, unless additional advisories suggest limiting in-person activity.
 
Please call us for more information later in the month of March to determine when our clinics will resume.
Thank you for your understanding.
Stay well.

name: School for the Blind
organization_name: CALIFORNIA STATE SCHOOL FOR THE BLIND
description: Offers an on-campus vocational and job skills program, as well as an apartment living program for older students. A comprehensive on-campus assessment program is provided to students who attend public schools (by referral only). A transition program is available to students age 14 or over.

name: TDRC
description: Offers employment, housing, vocational training, treatment services to individuals returning from custody or on probation, or pre-trial. Provides assistance in removing barriers and meeting court-ordered requirements.

name: Training Center
description: Provides a 16-week pre-apprentice training program for various types of skilled trades relevant to today's construction industry. Both hands-on and classroom training are emphasized and include a 32-hour each Asbestos and Lead Abatement course as well as a 40-hour Hazardous Material Handling course as part of the curriculum.

name: Tri-Cities One-Stop Career Center (Serving Fremont, Newark & Union City)
organization_name: EASTBAY WORKS - ONE STOP CAREER CENTERS
description:
Notes: Office is closed to the public. Staff is working remotely to assist clients. Assistance provided via online. Posted: 4-14-2020 11:30am SMR

Offers resources to the general public for the purpose of seeking jobs, training, or education. Resources specifically for job seekers and more focused support for special populations in the community. Also offers business resources and services specifically for employers. There is no charge for any of our services. Provides access to the California Employment Development Department's (EDD's) online CalJOBS program and access to filing for Unemployment Insurance on-line or call 800-300-5616.

name: Tri-Valley One-Stop Career Center
organization_name: EASTBAY WORKS - ONE STOP CAREER CENTERS
description:
Notes: Office is closed to the public. Staff is working remotely to assist clients. Assistance provided via online. Posted: 4-14-2020 11:30am SMR

A publicly-funded resource for jobs, employment, education, training, and business development in the Pleasanton, Dublin, and Tri-Valley communities. For more information about services and programs, a weekly orientation is held every week (by appointment only). Services offered include job search workshops with instruction in job seeking, resume writing and interviewing skills. Offers weekly job clubs and networking opportunities, vocational, career and supportive counseling as well as classroom and on-the-job training. Resources include: job listings, library of career-related materials, job search videos, information on vocational schools and training, community resources, labor market, and employers. Access to the California Employment Development Department's (EDD's) CalJOBS program. Offers basic beginning computer assistance. Provides computer stations with word processing, database, spreadsheet, internet resumes and career resource software as well as fax machines, copiers and phones for employer contact. Also assists employers in finding employees by posting job opportunities.

name: United Indian Nations Supportive Services
description: Provides employment counseling, job placement and training for any American Indian or Alaskan Native adults that are unemployed, underemployed or low-income. Offers classroom training in public or private vocational training schools. Pays the cost of transportation and books from a classroom training allowance. Provides assistance in locating on-the-job training and enrollment in school. Prospective employers throughout the Bay Area are encouraged to contact this agency.

name: Vocational Development Centers (VDC)
organization_name: THE ARC OF THE EAST BAY
description:
Note: Following the ‘Shelter-in-Place’ guidelines and all programs have been suspended till May 31st.  Programs are scheduled to resume in June, but this is all subject to change.  Staff will be reaching out through letters, telephone calls and updated website information.  This is to protect the residents of Alameda County from contracting COVID-19. Posted: 5-4-2020 9:27am SMR 

Trains individuals with intellectual and developmental disabilities for jobs. Provides environment for mastering assembly, warehouse and computer lab skills. Life skills instruction may include appropriate dressing and hygiene for work, basic health and safety rules, communication and interaction with supervisors and peers, punctuality and good attendance. Habilitation Coordinators (case managers) work with the individual's RCEB Case Manager, family and staff to improve appropriate workplace behaviors so the individual can demonstrate efficiency, dependability, and productivity on the job.

name: Women in Transition Program
organization_name: CHABOT - LAS POSITAS COMMUNITY COLLEGE DISTRICT CHABOT COLLEGE
description:
Notes: Departments and operators are not available until May 3rd. Check online, call or email for more detailed information. Posted: 4-16-2020 3:08pm SMR 

Provides a class and counseling for women facing career, educational and personal decisions following divorce, widowhood or other changes. The class is offered one afternoon a week for 9 weeks each semester. Call for further information. One unit of college credit is offered for this class.

name: Workforce Training Institute
description: Provides job training and placement services for low to moderate income individuals. Targets individuals in need of computer training.  CLASSES and TRAINING in: Microsoft Word, Excel, Access, Powerpoint.  JOB PREPARATION services include: assistance with: resume preparation, Internet access, online job search, pre-employment test preparation, and application submission.  JOB READINESS CERTIFICATION includes: enrollment into One-Stop Career Center services; completion of resume; obtaining an e-mail account; establishment of an EDD CalJob account; completion of a "job search portfolio" (cover letter, thank you letter/card, master application); and completion of job training (where applicable).

name: Working Women Program-6 Months
description:
Notes: Office is closed to the public but staff is working to provide services. Table outside for donation drop off. Posted: 4-14-2020 11:50am SMR 

Offers the Working Women Program for women (single or with children) who live a clean and sober lifestyle and are seeking additional support to break the cycle of homelessness. This program provides women who are working at least 20 hours/week the ability to gain long-term stability through a supportive, structured and safe environment.  This 6-month residential program includes case management, financial management skills and accountability, job skills training, bible studies and limited childcare if needed.

name: Write to Read Adult Literacy Program
description:
NOTE: Closed all 10 locations to public access effective 5 pm Sunday, March 15. We hope to reopen for regular operating hours on Wednesday, April 8. During our closure, you can still access our vast array of eResources 24/7 with your library card! Enjoy eBooks, eAudiobooks, eMagazines, movies, music and more from the comfort of your home. Visit our website aclibrary.org for information as conditions change.    
Posted: 3/31/2020, 2:11 PM, ar
Offers a variety of educational courses at multiple branch locations for adults such as:
  • basic adult reading
  • one-on-one tutoring
  • writing and spelling classes
  • conversation groups for second language learners
  • basic computer skills
  • job seeking skills classes
  • ESL classes
  • ESL job seeking

name: Young Adult Programs (Age 18-24)
description: Provides a range of job training opportunities for young people. Programs integrate leadership development, comprehensive support services, educational programming, and college enrollment with on-the-job vocational training. The Training Grounds include: Two cafes at the Oakland International Airport where young people learn customer service skills and the principles of operating a successful social enterprise. Building Futures: Trains young people in construction that directly benefits the community. Trainees are also supported to enroll in college to further their educational and employment skills.

name: America's Job Center of California AJCC - Fremont (FRC Building))
organization_name: EASTBAY WORKS - ONE STOP CAREER CENTERS
description:
Notes: Office is closed to the public. Staff is working remotely to assist clients. Assistance provided via online. Posted: 4-14-2020 11:30am SMR

Center provides resources and services that are focused on assisting any member of the community with job search, training information and career assistance. A fully equipped resource center with reference materials, internet access, computers and laser printer, fax, copier and telephones.  Provides access to the California Employment Development Department's (EDD's) online CalJOBS program and access to filing for Unemployment Insurance on-line or call 800-300-5616.

name: CalJOBS
organization_name: CALIFORNIA STATE EMPLOYMENT DEVELOPMENT DEPARTMENT - EDD
description:
No fee Internet system facilitates the match between employers and qualified workers. JOB SEEKERS can create and store their resume and browse job listings. If suitable openings are found, job seekers can make available a system-generated resume for online viewing by prospective employers. Available at any location with access to the Internet, including:
  • EDD Workforce Services Offices
  • One-Stop Centers

name: Champion Workforce (Employment)
organization_name: SOCIETY OF ST. VINCENT DE PAUL OF ALAMEDA COUNTY
description:
Note: Closed until further notice. Posted 4-10-2020 2:10pm SMR 

Assists homeless and extremely low-income adults to enter the workforce. The program is designed to systematically help participants address barriers to obtaining employment and receive training in key areas to develop workforce skills. After undergoing training, men and women are placed in temporary labor positions in painting, maintenance work, security and customer service.

name: Community Employment Services Program
organization_name: THE ARC OF THE EAST BAY
description:
Note: Following the ‘Shelter-in-Place’ guidelines and all programs have been suspended till May 31st.  Programs are scheduled to resume in June, but this is all subject to change.  Staff will be reaching out through letters, telephone calls and updated website information.  This is to protect the residents of Alameda County from contracting COVID-19. Posted: 5-4-2020 9:27am SMR 

Provides job search, placement and training, as well as travel training for adults with intellectual and developmental disabilities. Assists in developing employment opportunities with businesses in the community, and matches individuals eager to work with those employers. Provides ongoing job coaching and support at no cost to the individual or company. Provides support such as mobility training to ensure the person can get to the work site, individualized job coaching, education about benefits and responsibilities of SSI/SSA recipients, and referral to independent living skills programs.

name: Computer Access and Services
description:
Offers classes and services with respect to the following:
  • Resume Writing
  • Internet Research
  • Internet Job Search
  • Online Banking Assistance

Information is kept confidential.

description: Provides employment assistance and case management for individual who has difficulty finding a job.

name: Fremont Family Resource Center/SparkPoint Fremont
organization_name: CITY OF FREMONT HUMAN SERVICES DEPARTMENT
description:
NOTE: The Fremont Family Resource Center (FRC) building located at 39155 Liberty Street which houses 24 State, County, City and Non-Profit Organizations at this time will remain open until further notice.  Each agency will be determing its own schedule and staffing level.
 
However, the FRC City office (Suite A110) will be closed to the general public.  Telecare services will be offered for the following programs:  For families and individuals seeking support, telecare support and resources will be offered remotely by Fremont Support Coordinators.  Please call 510-574-2021 and leave a message with your name and phone number.

For SparkPoint Fremont, financial coaching will be handled remotely.  Please call 510-574-2020 for more information. Posted 4/7/2020, 10:17 AM, pg

WELCOME CENTER
Provides:
  • adult and youth employment services
  • childcare information and referral
  • counseling and mental health services
  • housing classes
  • cash assistance
  • parent support services
  • nutrition education programs
  • immigration services
  • some legal services
  • enrollment assistance in completing Medi-Cal and CalFresh or other applications. 

FAMILY SUPPORT SERVICES:
Offers a case management service that includes:
  • assessment
  • service planning
  • information and referral
  • linkage to community resources
  • advocacy
  • ongoing support. 

CAL-WORKSs FAMILY SERVICE TEAM:
(Cal-WORKs participants) Supports multiple organizations working with families to successfully achieve goals.

SPARKPOINT CENTER:
Offers free financial coaching and services. Helps people: increase their income and savings, manage debt, establish/improve credit, create a budget, file taxes. Additionally aid in job search and assist with landlord/tenant mediation.

DISCOVERY COVE DROP-IN CHILD CARE: Provides free childcare to FRC clients with ages 2 months to 12 years old. As well as affordable drop-in services to community parents with children ages 2 to 10 years old.

name: Homeless Supportive Services
description:
Provides temporary shelter for homeless individuals and families in Alameda County. Offers programs linked to supportive services for homeless families, single adults and youth in Alameda county. Each Abode Services program integrates two components to help clients establish permanent stability and return to productive lives: Housing Options, which include emergency shelter, transitional housing and permanent supportive housing; and Supportive Services, which include case management, job counseling and placement, life skills classes, financial literacy training, parenting classes, children's programs, drug and alcohol counseling, mental health counseling and support groups.

Abode Services may provide referrals to qualifying individuals, for Homeless & Caring Court.  Court is held at the Alameda County Public Defender’s Office in Oakland.

name: Job Placement Services
description:
Note: Office is closed to the public. Staff is working remotely but still offering limited services. Posted: 4-20-20 1:54pm SMR 

Provides an array of employment and training services in a convenient, easily accessible location. Offers job placement services to the community via a career advisor and a job developer that assists clients daily with resume creation, and job coaching.

name: Job Referral Assistance
description: Assists individuals with referrals to job opportunities. Agency has developed relationships with employers in the Tri-Cities area  who notify program when employees are needed. Also assists individuals interested in applying for In-Home Supportive Services (IHSS) and other public employment opportunities.

name: Mastick Senior Center
organization_name: CITY OF ALAMEDA RECREATION AND PARKS DEPARTMENT
description:
NOTE: Mastick Senior Center is closed except for the lunch program, the computer lab and the food bank. Posted: 3/30/2020, 4:49 PM, ar

Offers a variety of recreational and social service programs for seniors. Program targets the needs of the senior population in the Alameda area. Services include senior employment, education programs, and field trips.

name: Newcomer Assistance
description: Offers immigration assistance with completing forms and the naturalization process. Provides employment listings, referral information, and translation services. Also offers alcohol and drug prevention education.

name: Preparing Oakland Native Youth
description:
Offers guidance and support for older youth to reconnect with their goals and prepare for adulthood through workshops, mentoring, case management, counseling, cultural programs, and field trips. Assistance can include:
  • Applying for tribal enrollment
  • Getting an ID card, birth certificate, etc.
  • Getting back into high school; Enrolling in a GED program
  • Applying for college and figuring out financial aid
  • Finding a training program that fits interests
  • Writing a resume and looking for a job and more

name: Refuge and Immigrant Program
organization_name: VIETNAMESE AMERICAN COMMUNITY CENTER OF THE EAST BAY (VACCEB)
description: Services offered to refugee and immigrant communities include: ESL and citizenship classes, a domestic violence and behavioral health hotline, health screenings, case management, senior services, and computer literacy classes.  Offers a wide range of employment services to immigrants and refugee that are legal residents.

organization_name: CATHOLIC CHARITIES OF THE EAST BAY - CCEB

Provides refugees with job search skills, employment counseling, job development, and job placement to help them effectively integrate into American life. Also assists with job retention. Vocational ESL provided at Oakland office. Services also provided in Spanish at Oakland office.

Dear Members of our Community:
As the news of the coronavirus (COVID-19) continues to evolve, we at Catholic Charities East Bay are making efforts to protect the health of our staff and of our community.
