name: Services for the Blind
description:
Offers services to the blind and visually impaired, including:
  • employment assistance information
  • job opportunity information
  • information and referral
  • legal and advocacy services
  • toll-free newsline ( which provides miscellaneous information about resources )
  • products and issues that may affect individuals with visual impairments
  • Publishes a quarterly magazine "The Blind Californian" in large print form, on tape, and in Braille

**The newsline can be reached daily at 800-221-6359, 10 am to 4 pm, including weekends and holidays. It can be heard in English and Spanish. Accepts donations of vehicles.**

name: South Alameda County Youth and College Division
organization_name: NATIONAL ASSOCIATION FOR THE ADVANCEMENT OF COLORED PEOPLE (NAACP)
description:
Provides cross-cultural social activities and education to minority children, youth and adults, age 7-25. Offers:
  • health and human rights advocacy
  • a scholarship drive
  • community awareness
  • summer employment referrals
  • Black History Celebration

name: The Lord Provides Resource Center
description: Assist the residents of the West Oakland community. Strives to place local people into local jobs and housing units by referrals. Is a self-help and one-stop career service center that offers a full staff, a computer lab, career counseling classes, tutoring, resume writing, counseling, case management, and job and housing search assistance.

name: Transitional Age Youth (TAY) Program
description:
Note: No changes have occurred. Call for more information. Posted: 4-20-20 11:57am SMR 

Offers program to divert young adults from the criminal justice system by offering tailored, collaborative services based on each participants strengths and needs. Provides participants with the opportunity to access needed services and earn a dismissal of their charges by the criminal court. TAY is a voluntary one year, phased- based program. Services are initially provided in juvenile hall (approximately 30-45 days) with the remainder of the program occurring in the community under the supervision of a probation officer.

name: Tri-Cities One-Stop Career Center (Serving Fremont, Newark & Union City)
organization_name: EASTBAY WORKS - ONE STOP CAREER CENTERS
description:
Notes: Office is closed to the public. Staff is working remotely to assist clients. Assistance provided via online. Posted: 4-14-2020 11:30am SMR

Offers resources to the general public for the purpose of seeking jobs, training, or education. Resources specifically for job seekers and more focused support for special populations in the community. Also offers business resources and services specifically for employers. There is no charge for any of our services. Provides access to the California Employment Development Department's (EDD's) online CalJOBS program and access to filing for Unemployment Insurance on-line or call 800-300-5616.

name: Tri-Valley One-Stop Career Center
organization_name: EASTBAY WORKS - ONE STOP CAREER CENTERS
description:
Notes: Office is closed to the public. Staff is working remotely to assist clients. Assistance provided via online. Posted: 4-14-2020 11:30am SMR

A publicly-funded resource for jobs, employment, education, training, and business development in the Pleasanton, Dublin, and Tri-Valley communities. For more information about services and programs, a weekly orientation is held every week (by appointment only). Services offered include job search workshops with instruction in job seeking, resume writing and interviewing skills. Offers weekly job clubs and networking opportunities, vocational, career and supportive counseling as well as classroom and on-the-job training. Resources include: job listings, library of career-related materials, job search videos, information on vocational schools and training, community resources, labor market, and employers. Access to the California Employment Development Department's (EDD's) CalJOBS program. Offers basic beginning computer assistance. Provides computer stations with word processing, database, spreadsheet, internet resumes and career resource software as well as fax machines, copiers and phones for employer contact. Also assists employers in finding employees by posting job opportunities.

name: United Indian Nations Supportive Services
description: Provides employment counseling, job placement and training for any American Indian or Alaskan Native adults that are unemployed, underemployed or low-income. Offers classroom training in public or private vocational training schools. Pays the cost of transportation and books from a classroom training allowance. Provides assistance in locating on-the-job training and enrollment in school. Prospective employers throughout the Bay Area are encouraged to contact this agency.

name: Upwardly Global
description: Offers services for recently-arrived immigrant, refugee, and asylee professionals that come to the US with at least a 4-year university degree and some professional experience. Offers a range of services to help immigrant professionals rebuild careers in the United States including resume and cover letter writing support, coaching on targeting a professional job search, connections to professional peers, and workshops on networking and interviewing skills.

name: West Oakland Community Information/Referral Services
description: The West Oakland Community Information Center works with a variety of participants, businesses, vendors and agencies in Oakland. Some of their services include: information on employment opportunities, free meal agencies information, housing/shelter referral, contact information for agencies that assist with first and last month rent deposit, provide medical and education information, contact information for agencies that assist with utility payments, assist eligible clients with clean slate (removal) of criminal record, Early Head Start and a variety of referrals for other socioeconomic services during these challenging times today.The West Oakland Community Information Center serves the community in OWH's front office on 8th Street. The goal of the the information center, is to help people make healthy life style choices, retain their independence, integrity, and overcome adversity.

name: Workforce Training Institute
description: Provides job training and placement services for low to moderate income individuals. Targets individuals in need of computer training.  CLASSES and TRAINING in: Microsoft Word, Excel, Access, Powerpoint.  JOB PREPARATION services include: assistance with: resume preparation, Internet access, online job search, pre-employment test preparation, and application submission.  JOB READINESS CERTIFICATION includes: enrollment into One-Stop Career Center services; completion of resume; obtaining an e-mail account; establishment of an EDD CalJob account; completion of a "job search portfolio" (cover letter, thank you letter/card, master application); and completion of job training (where applicable).

name: Youth and Family Services
organization_name: EAST BAY SPANISH SPEAKING CITIZENS' FOUNDATION (SSCF)
description: Provides educational, job referral and training services to help youth and adults further educate themselves and become community and civic leaders. Helps families and youth integrate into society and navigate the process of becoming responsible productive United States citizens. Advocates and offers services to people with disabilities; informal translation, interpretation and filling out forms.

name: Youth Employment Opportunity Program (YEOP)
organization_name: CALIFORNIA STATE EMPLOYMENT DEVELOPMENT DEPARTMENT - EDD
description:
Provides special services to youth age 15-25. Assists youth in achieving their educational and vocational goals. Services include:
  • peer advising
  • referrals to supportive services
  • workshops
  • job referrals
  • placement assistance
  • referrals to training and community outreach centers

name: Youth Programs (Age 14-17)
description: Offers after-school and summer jobs for school-age youth: Also provides leadership, communication, financial literacy, and conflict resolution training, as well as comprehensive support services to help youth keep on a positive path. Utilizes paid employment as a powerful incentive for youth to stay in school and improve academic performance.

name: YouthWorks
organization_name: CITY OF BERKELEY HEALTH, HOUSING AND COMMUNITY SERVICES DEPARTMENT
description: Operates after-school and summer employment programs for Berkeley youth, age 14-25. Assesses skills to match youth with appropriate jobs, brokers employment opportunities, conducts job-readiness workshops, and collaborates with community-based organizations that provide youth services.

name: ACBHCS Vocational Program
organization_name: ALAMEDA COUNTY BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CARE SERVICES (ACBHCS)
description:
Note: Due to many pharmacies being currently shuttered, and in case of the event of a prescribing emergency the pharmacy team and the Office of the Medical Director is available to assist in identifying alternate resources.  Please call 510-567-8106.

Note: Office is not open to the public. Call for more information. 
Posted 4-10-2020 3:19pm SMR

Provides Individual Placement and Support, Supported Employment to mental health consumers that have expressed an interest to work. Consumers are referred from Service Teams representing mental health clinics in Alameda County Behavioral Health Care Services (ACBHCS). Job Plans are based on the individual preferences of the consumer and include vocational counseling and outreach, competitive job search and retention, and ongoing collaboration with individuals team.

name: Best Now!
organization_name: ALAMEDA COUNTY NETWORK OF MENTAL HEALTH CLIENTS  (ACNMHC)
description:
Note: Services are offered via phone and online. Visit website for more information. Posted: 4-20-20 3:11pm SMR 

Offers a training, job readiness and internship program for mental health consumers who want to work in the behavioral health care field as Peer Support Specialists.

name: CalWORKs Program
description:
CalWORKs promotes short-term training as well as life-long learning. The ultimate goal of the program is to assist CalWORKs students with vocational/educational training programs that lead to self-sufficiency. CalWORKs students receive the following services:
*assessment of academic
*vocational and/or career choices
*academic advising
*the development of county-approved educational plan
*academic and career advising
*job placement assistance for both on-campus and off-campus employment.
To be eligible for CalWORKs services, students must participate in the County's CalWORKs program.

name: Computer Technician Training (CTT)
description: Prepares students for a career as a computer support specialist or a network/system administrator. Students in these fields need to have practical hands-on experience and that is exactly what NTST is designed to do. It is a comprehensive vocational training program that offers students a chance to learn real workplace skills that are both technical and professional. Students learn what is expected of on the job, from troubleshooting computer and networking problems to reporting to supervisors in a professional way.

name: Employment Programs
description: CAF operates a Work Activity Program (WAP). In collaboration with the Regional Center of East Bay and the California Department of Rehabilitation. The Work Activity Program is CARF (Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities) accredited. WAP has been providing individuals with vocational skills and paid work experience. This business division is called Custom Assembly and Packaging (CAP). CAP operates an on-site Assembly and Packaging business at CAF Richmond facility. Working with Custom Assembly and Packaging, individuals enrolled in the WAP program are employed by CAP. Provide packaging, labeling and assembly services for a variety of businesses that have contracted with CAP. Participants earn an income and are provided resources. Enables them to secure more mainstream employment. To augment the participants vocational training and developing employment skills, individuals are provided on-site adult education classes.

name: Employment Services
description: Offers comprehensive vocational training that leads to a job. In addition to regular one-on-one interaction and feedback, a series of employment service classes that teach students how to get and retain a job is provided.

name: Employment Services (ES)
description:
Notes: Office is closed to the public. Phone intakes only. Posted: 4-16-2020 10:08am SMR 

Assists disabled clients (primarily developmentally disabled) who are clients of the Department of Rehabilitation to become successfully employed by businesses in the community. Taking into consideration factors such as type of employment desired, hours desired, and physical limitations, EBI then contacts employers to develop opportunities. Once a suitable job match is found, EBI provides services to help clients successfully learn and maintain the job. These services include: assistance learning public transportation routes to and from work, or assistance accessing paratransit services; job coaching; assistance in understanding how wages affect benefits like Supplemental Security Income (SSI) and Social Security Disability Income (SSDI).

name: Housing Scholarship Program (For Students in Fremont)
organization_name: FREMONT CITY COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT DEPARTMENT - HOUSING DIVISION
description:
Note: Office is closed to the public. Development Services is suspending most services for all divisions, but staff will be available by phone or email to provide assistance and answer questions. Posted: 4-29-2020 4:08pm SMR 

The innovative Housing Scholarship Program. Provides "rent scholarships" to income eligible applicants enrolled in vocational job-training programs.

name: Men of Valor Academy
description: Provides former incarcerated men with spiritual, physical, emotional, mental growth and development, as well as the skills and education needed in order to become productive citizens in the community.  Also provides mentorship services in collaboration with the Acts full Gospel Church. Offers transitional housing for six (6) months to a year for those that participate in the program. In addition, the MOVA provides each participant with resume writing, employment assistance, computer and financial literacy.

name: Pro Customer Service and Administrator Training
description: PRO graduates are suited to a wide variety of entry level jobs such as; customer service, administrator roles and retail, sales positions such as; cashier, office clerk, receptionist and telephone and customer service representative.

name: School for the Blind
organization_name: CALIFORNIA STATE SCHOOL FOR THE BLIND
description: Offers an on-campus vocational and job skills program, as well as an apartment living program for older students. A comprehensive on-campus assessment program is provided to students who attend public schools (by referral only). A transition program is available to students age 14 or over.

name: TDRC
description: Offers employment, housing, vocational training, treatment services to individuals returning from custody or on probation, or pre-trial. Provides assistance in removing barriers and meeting court-ordered requirements.

name: Treasure Island Job Corps Center
organization_name: DAVIS AND ASSOCIATES INC. NORTHERN CALIFORNIA OUTREACH AND ADMISSIONS
description: A nationwide, government-subsidized youth training program. Provides remedial education, vocational training and useful work experience including on-the-job training for low and moderate-income, disadvantaged youth. Provides room and board along with a stipend. Admissions counselors help eligible youth enter Job Corps centers. DESI helps thousands of youth receive the job training and opportunities needed to succeed.

name: Valley Community Support Center
organization_name: ALAMEDA COUNTY BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CARE SERVICES (ACBHCS)
description:
Note: Office is not open to the public. Call for more information. 
Posted 4-10-2020 3:19pm SMR

Comprehensive mental health services for persons with chronic and persistent mental illness. Services include case management, medication therapy, screening for psychiatric hospitalization, and consultation and referral to other services such as vocational rehabilitation.

name: Vocational Development Centers (VDC)
organization_name: THE ARC OF THE EAST BAY
description:
Note: Following the ‘Shelter-in-Place’ guidelines and all programs have been suspended till May 31st.  Programs are scheduled to resume in June, but this is all subject to change.  Staff will be reaching out through letters, telephone calls and updated website information.  This is to protect the residents of Alameda County from contracting COVID-19. Posted: 5-4-2020 9:27am SMR 

Trains individuals with intellectual and developmental disabilities for jobs. Provides environment for mastering assembly, warehouse and computer lab skills. Life skills instruction may include appropriate dressing and hygiene for work, basic health and safety rules, communication and interaction with supervisors and peers, punctuality and good attendance. Habilitation Coordinators (case managers) work with the individual's RCEB Case Manager, family and staff to improve appropriate workplace behaviors so the individual can demonstrate efficiency, dependability, and productivity on the job.

name: Vocational Support Services
description:
Note: DOR continues to provide services and advocacy resulting in employment, independent living, and equality for individuals with disabilities. Continue to serve all our consumers during this time but also value the health and safety of everyone. To protect the health and safety of our consumers and staff, we are applying appropriate social distancing guidelines. Posted: 5-1-2020 4:38pm SMR 

Helps find employment and assists in becoming independent. Also offers vocational support services to Students, youth, and young adults.

name: Young Adult Programs (Age 18-24)
description: Provides a range of job training opportunities for young people. Programs integrate leadership development, comprehensive support services, educational programming, and college enrollment with on-the-job vocational training. The Training Grounds include: Two cafes at the Oakland International Airport where young people learn customer service skills and the principles of operating a successful social enterprise. Building Futures: Trains young people in construction that directly benefits the community. Trainees are also supported to enroll in college to further their educational and employment skills.

name: California Community Transitions (CCT)
description:
Notes: Office is closed to the public. Phone intakes only. Posted: 4-16-2020 10:08am SMR 

Offers support with applying for affordable housing, provides basic home modifications for accessibility, apply for IHSS and the MediCal Home and Community Based Waivers, pay first month's rent and deposit if necessary to get housing outside of the SNF and identify needed healthcare professionals in the community.

CCT services only available to people with disabilities who are eligible for MediCal and have resided in a skilled nursing facility for a minimum of 90 days.

name: City of Livermore Emergency Rent Gap Assistance Program
description: One time only, gap loan designed to assist low income families and individuals who are experiencing a loss of income and inability to pay rent due to the COVID-19 public health emergency. Up to $2,500 per household, deferred payments and no interest on this personal loan.

name: CityServe Support Services
description:
Coordinates resources, including motel vouchers when available, volunteers between the faith-based community, non-profits, schools, businesses and government agencies to meet human service needs and connecting volunteers in the local church and community to the non-profits in their Tri-Valley. Serves individuals/families in crisis situations for emergency motel nights (they do not provide motel vouchers, they pay direct to motels specific to individuals/families), helps with rent to avoid displacement, and with utilities to avoid service shut off. Also offers auto repair, auto donations when available, transportation assistance (Bus, Bart tickets), emergency food (Gift cards). 

NOTE: Refer homeless clients who are in Tri-Valley only and they will put them on a list for motel vouchers.  Do not make any promises because the medically fragile will be given priority.  Refer to other agencies for food, if possible. Working with their current caseload to provide food and are swamped.   Posted 3/25/2020, 5:22 PM, pg

name: Emergency Financial Assistance – Age 18 to 54 – BACS
description:
DOCUMENTATION REQUIRED TO RECEIVE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE?
> Completed application with Housing Crisis documentation
> ID or other proof of identify if ID not available
> Proof of Income
> W-9 from landlord or new lease agreement.

For adults (18-54 years old)

NOTE: Any families or individuals who are still sheltered but face a crisis such as a 3-day pay or quit notice or an eviction notice.
- Call BACS Keep Oakland Housed Program at 510-613-0330 x2
Posted 3/24/2020, 9:59 AM, pg


Effective 02/24/2020 (open to all ages and household types)

Offers support services and emergency financial assistance to eligible City of Oakland residents. Helps prevent clients from losing their homes and stabilize their housing for the long-term. Also helps sustain household (or rapidly rehouse) after intervention. 
 
  • 30% Area Median Income (AMI) or lower
  • Non-leaseholder
  • Priority given to voucher holders
  • All ages and household types
  • Program is not for homeowners, only renters. Callers are eligible for assistance even if they have received assistance from Season of Sharing.
  • Provides relocation assistance (move-in costs, deposit, etc.) to Oakland residents whether or not they are moving into a unit in Oakland. Required to identify with current Oakland residency/homelessness. Will support relocation within and beyond Oakland.

name: Emergency Financial Assistance – Age 55+ and Families with Children – Catholic Charities of East Bay
description:
DOCUMENTATION REQUIRED TO RECEIVE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE?
> Completed application with Housing Crisis documentation
> ID or other proof of identify if ID not available
> Proof of Income
> W-9 from landlord or new lease agreement.
May be single or family, must be  a low-income Oakland resident


Effective 2/24/2020: 
Offers support services and emergency financial assistance (rent, deposit, court settlements and other stabilization assistance) for eligible City of Oakland residents. 
  • 30% AMI or lower (mostly those on fixed incomes)
  • Priority given to voucher holders or deeply affordable rentals (defined as 50% or less of the rent to income ratio) 
  • All ages and household types 
  • NO change to requirement of having to be a leaseholder 
  • All legal agencies will refer to Catholic Charities 
  • Not for homeowners, only renters.  Callers are eligible for assistance even if they have received assistance from Season of Sharing. 
NOTE:  Continues to take calls for KEEP OAKLAND HOUSED. Leave message on general number and someone will call back. Posted 3/24/2020, 12:17 PM, pg

name: Emergency Rent and Housing Assistance Fund
description:
Note:  Oakland LGBTQ Center is open M-F, 12pm-5pm for pick-up of free food and hygiene bags.
Posted:  4/8/2020, 9:46 am, am

LOW FEE MENTAL HEALTH SUPPORT
Jonathan Julian is an AMFT serving the community through their practice at the Oakland LGBTQ Community Center. They are offering shorter term, low-fee therapy sessions between $30-$60 specifically for our LGBTQIA+ family who are struggling with their mental health during the Covid-19  pandemic. If you or a loved one needs extra support, you can find me on https://openpathcollective.org/ by searching my name. I specialize in expressive arts therapy and somatic mindfulness. Learn more about me at https://jjuliantherapy.com/

This fund will allow the Center to provide emergency rental assistance. Assistance available to low-income individuals and families, living in Oakland and Alameda County. The purpose of the fund is to prevent homelessness before it happens. 

**Will only be available until the funds run out**

name: Fremont Cares Rent Relief Program
description: The Fremont Cares Rent Relief Program provides rental assistance, using federal Community Development Block Grant (CDBG) CARES funds, to eligible households who are unable to pay their rent due to a COVID 19-related job loss or loss of income. The Fremont Cares Rent Relief Program can provide for rent beginning March 17, 2020, the date of the first Shelter in Place order. Funds can be used to pay up to three (3) months of unpaid rent directly to the landlord.

name: HELP Flexible Funding
organization_name: ALAMEDA COUNTY SOCIAL SERVICES AGENCY WORKFORCE AND BENEFITS ADMINISTRATION
description: Offers single adults who are homeless or at risk of becoming homeless help with a one-time emergency assistance. This will prevent homelessness or help transition to permanent housing (also for critical needs).

name: Housing and Financial Services
organization_name: CATHOLIC CHARITIES OF THE EAST BAY - CCEB
description:
NOTE: Catholic Charities have updated their intake call hours to Mondays and Thursdays from 9a-12p for Keep Oakland Housed funds. Call  510-768-3100 (main number).Posted 4/15/2020, 9:00 AM, pg

NOTE: Until May 1 Catholic Charities will not going to be able to help with deposits for those who currently have leases.BACS is still able to help those without leases with housing problem-solving and possible financial assistance.  Posted 4/5/2020, 11:56 AM, pg

Provides EVICTION PREVENTION services for individuals or families experiencing a housing crisis. Program includes security deposit and 1st month’s rent assistance and eviction prevention assistance (back rent). Clients must have a rental agreement or 3-day eviction notice before applying for back rent. They must have a lease agreement and/or a passed inspection for move-in funds.
Please call 510-768-3100 to get the most updated information on their services. ELIGIBILITY: For Season of Sharing funds, must meet SoS eligibility criteria. May be able to access other funding available, call for assessment. They are currently serving OAKLAND residents only. Must call for pre-screening. No walk-ins.

March 11, 2020

Dear Members of our Community:
As the news of the coronavirus (COVID-19) continues to evolve, we at Catholic Charities East Bay are making efforts to protect the health of our staff and of our community.
We are therefore cancelling all walk-in consultation and housing clinics through the end of March.
Individual appointments and other business operations will continue, unless additional advisories suggest limiting in-person activity.
 
Please call us for more information later in the month of March to determine when our clinics will resume.
Thank you for your understanding.
Stay well.

The Housing Services Office operates the BHCS Housing Assistance Fund. This revolving fund was created to provide a flexible source of financial assistance to help BHCS consumers and their families move out of homelessness into stable housing of their choice and to prevent them from becoming homeless. The Fund is intended to help individual consumers obtain and maintain long-term, stable housing. In order to maintain the funding source, recipients are encouraged to give back to the EveryOne Home Fund in order to assist others who may be in need.

name: Rental Relief Program for Hayward and Emeryville
description:
NOTE:  Hayward now has funds to reopen program for coverage of April and May rent only. Emeryville does not have funds. Posted 7/8/2020 11:17 AM, PG:

Offers rental assistance to residents who are at greatest risk of displacement due to non-payment of rent related to the COVID-19 pandemic. Offset corresponding lost revenue that landlords need to provide housing services. The program provides a onetime rent relief grant directly to landlords on behalf of low-income tenants. This will reduce burden on tenants and ensure landlords receive the revenue needed to maintain housing services. Bay Area Community Services (BACS) will be administering the program on behalf of the City of Hayward.

name: Roads Home - Supportive Services for Veterans Families (SSVF) - Oakland
description:
Provides supportive services to veteran households, working to help end homelessness among veterans and their families. Offers Veteran families with housing stability through obtaining or maintaining permanent housing, temporary rental assistance, or rapid re-housing. Additional support through peer outreach and internships, wraparound case management, links to healthcare and VA benefits assistance, and employment services.

Transitional Housing Program offers temporary housing (6-24 months) and intensive life skills training.

name: Season of Sharing (SOS)
organization_name: ALAMEDA COUNTY SOCIAL SERVICES AGENCY SEASON OF SHARING (SOS)
description:
NOTE: Lobbies are Temporarily Closed to Help Prevent the Spread of COVID-19. The below Alameda County Social Services Agency office lobbies are currently closed. We will continue to provide essential services. Clients who are receiving or wish to apply for Medi-Cal, CalFresh, CalWORKs, Refugee Cash Assistance, and General Assistance may use available telephone, fax, mail, and online services. Applications, renewals, documents, and reports can be submitted for most programs online at www.MyBenefitsCalWIN.org. You may also submit information by fax at 510-670-5095 or by mail at P.O. Box 12941, Oakland, CA 94604.

During the temporary closure, limited in-person access will be available for the following:
  • Emergency Electronic Benefit Transfer (EBT) Card/ Benefits Identification Card (BIC) or check pick-up
  • Homeless mail pick-up
  • Cash Assistance Program for Immigrants (CAPI) Applications
  • Clients who do not have access to a telephone and need to comply with a required program interview
Applications will continue to be available at offices in designated areas for all benefit programs, and community members may complete, sign and return documents for processing using a secure drop box during regular business hours, 8:30 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. Application Forms With Links

 Posted 3/24/2020, 3:50 PM, pg

The Alameda County Season of Sharing (SOS) Program aims to stabilize eligible individuals or families facing an isolated and short-term crisis not of their own making by providing one-time critical needs or housing assistance to regain their long-term self-sufficiency. Types of assistance provided include security deposit funds for households who are at risk of losing or have lost their housing; delinquent rent or mortgage funds to maintain housing. Simply meeting these criteria does not entitle applicants to receive assistance; they must also show an extreme need/merit.  Because each household situation is unique, the SOS program evaluates requests on a case-by-case basis. Assistance is not guaranteed. Also assists approved applicants with medical or mobility equipment (walkers, scooters, or other life-sustaining equipment not covered by insurance that are medically necessary for them to remain independent).

name: Season of Sharing (SOS) (ONLY People with disabilities Receiving SSI or SSDI)
description:
NOTE: CRIL has moved to a virtual office.  If you call, leave a message and your call will be routed to the appropriate person.  You may also email staff. Posted 3/27/2020, 2:48 PM, pg

Provides emergency-based assistance with housing and/or critical family needs on a non-recurring basis. After receiving one-time assistance from SOS, client should be able to pay rent, buy food, and pay other bills. Nursing home / institution transition funds and assistance are also available through CRIL.

name: Short Term Housing Assistance for People with HIV/AIDS
organization_name: ALAMEDA COUNTY COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT AGENCY HOUSING AND COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT DEPARTMENT
description:
Note: Much of the staff is working remotely but the office is open to the public. Office is following social distancing guidelines and will not allow anyone in if they have a fever or are exhibiting any symptoms of COVID-19. Posted 4-15-2020 4:05pm SMR 

Rent/Mortgage and Utility (STRMU) Assistance Program for people with HIV/AIDS. A time-limited housing assistance program designed to prevent homelessness and increase housing stability. Assistance may be provided for a maximum of up to 21 weeks in any 52 week period. In order to be eligible client must be able to prove HIV+status and have eligible qualifying emergency need.

name: Supportive Services for Veteran Families (SSVF)
description:
Note: Hours of operation have changed. Now only open Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays from 1pm to 4pm. Posted: 4-13-2020 10:07am SMR.

Provides low income homeless veterans with help in locating and securing permanent affordable housing. Services include:
  • short term case management
  • assessment
  • eligibility screening
  • rental, eviction and utility prevention services
  • money management services
  • legal services in the areas of Veteran disability benefits, and discharge upgrades
  • temporary funds assistance

SSVF Referral This program provides short-term financial assistance and housing navigation for eligible homeless veterans. It is administered by local non-profit agencies, not the VA. This referral is NOT a guarantee of financial assistance. It is a referral for screening, and the provider will work with veteran to obtain the paperwork needed for enrollment in the program.

organization_name: CITY OF BERKELEY HEALTH, HOUSING AND COMMUNITY SERVICES DEPARTMENT
description:
Assists persons with disabilities and those age 70 or over with access to different transportation services. Those with visual impairments should notify staff of special communication requirements. The four programs include:

TAXI SCRIP PROGRAM:
Provides voucher to pay for rides on conventional taxicabs and wheelchair-accessible taxicabs.

WHEELCHAIR-VAN PROGRAM:
Provides a free van voucher and/or free taxi scrip exclusively to wheelchair users. Provides van service for rides that are beyond the scope of services provided by East Bay Paratransit/ATC.

EAST BAY PARATRANSIT TICKETS:
Provide a limited number of free East Bay Paratransit/ATC tickets to individuals certified by East Bay Paratransit.

MEDICAL RETURN TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM (MrTrip):
May reimburse for rides home from healthcare appointment when voucher or scrip was used.

description: Provides application process for one of the Title IV Federal Student Aid programs of the U.S. Department of Education.FEDERAL STUDENT AID GRANTS include: Federal Pell Grants, Federal Supplemental Educational Opportunity Grants (FSEOG), Academic Competitiveness Grants (ACG), National Science and Mathematics Access to Retain Talent (National SMART), Teacher Education Assistance for College and Higher Education Grants (TEACH), and Leveraging Educational Assistance Partnership (LEAP) and Special LEAP Grants.FEDERAL STUDENT AID LOANS include: Direct Loan Program (Stafford, PLUS and Consolitation loans), Federal Perkins Loans.FEDERAL STUDENT AID WORK-STUDY: Work-Study programs.For application assistance, the Federal Student Aid Information Center can be contacted in the following ways: FAFSA On The Web - "Live Help" (secure online chat session with FAFSA customer service representative), by phone or by e-mail.

name: Student Services
description: ADMISSIONS AND RECORDS: Students may enroll online, by phone or in person. Assists students who wish to drop and add classes, get information about prerequisites, or apply for transcripts. Located in Building R, Room R112. DISABLED STUDENT PROGRAMS AND SERVICES: Helps students with verified disability to take steps or evaluate entitlement to receive accommodations in the college setting. Accommodations must be reasonable and are provided to give disabled students a fair chance at success in school. Disabilities may be physical, sensory, cognitive, psychiatric, and health-related. Located in Room P300 FINANCIAL AID: Assists with information and applications for federal and state financial assistance, fee waivers, grants, loans, scholarships and federal work study. Located in Building R, Room R113. FRUITVALE EDUCATION CENTER: Instructional program and bilingual student services. ESL assessment, ESL classes, ESL computer classes, bilingual counseling, and registration assistance. Located at 1900 Fruitvale Avenue, Suite 1C. GENERAL COUNSELING: provides academic, career, and personal counseling services to help students identify educational, career and personal goals and develop plans to achieve those goals. Also refers students to other on-campus services. Some counseling services available on a drop-in basis while others require a scheduled appointment, 510-434-2475. MAXIMUM ACHIEVEMENT PROJECT (MAP): Aims to increase graduation rates of African-American males and low-income students. Mentoring, tutoring and paid internships. Learning, leadership and employment opportunities. To apply, contact 510-434-2475. PUENTE PROJECT: Mission is to increase the number of educationally disadvantaged students who enroll in four-year colleges and universities, earn college degrees, and return to the community as mentors and leaders. Puente Project Counselor can be reached at 510-434-3943. Located in Building R, Room R105H.

name: Student Services
description: ADMISSIONS AND RECORDS: first point of access for new students and the general public. Students may enroll (online, by phone, in person), drop or add classes, apply for transcripts and handle other admissions business. DISABLED STUDENTS PROGRAMS AND SERVICES (DSPS) offers the following, designed to facilitate the success of students with disabilities: Disability Resource Center, Deaf Services, High Tech Center (specialized computer lab open to all students with disabilities), Learning Skills Program, and Workability III.  EXTENDED OPPORTUNITY PROGRAM AND SERVICES (EOPS) encourages the enrollment, retention and transfer of students with language, social, economic and educational disadvantages. Provides counseling, peer advising, tutoring, financial assistance, transfer, career and personal development assistance. Eligibility requirements apply.  FINANCIAL AID OFFICE provides information and assistance regarding how to apply for financial aid (Pell Grants, FAFSA, Student Aid Reports). VETERAN AFFAIRS PROGRAM offers information and assistance to veterans and veteran dependents that are eligible for educational benefits through the U.S. Department of Veteran Affairs. Also, offers Summer Session Classes.

Provides food assistance through member agencies who obtain food from the Food Bank and serve meals or provide food bags to local residents in need. The Food Bank also educates the community and public officials about the causes of hunger and poverty.

Also operates a website called Food Now, at http://foodnow.net/ for referral to weekend and after-hours food sites. People can click a button called I Need Food Today and search by full address, city or zip code. This same link in Spanish is: http://comidaahora.net/.

Also offers referrals and application assistance toward food programs such as Food Stamps, School Meals and WIC (Women, Infants and Children).

NOTE: Expansion of CalFresh to SSI/SSP Recipients!
Beginning June 1, 2019, recipients of SSI/SSP benefits may be eligible for CalFresh Food benefits for the first time! There is no change to the SSI/SSP monthly benefit. To learn about this policy change, and information on how SSI recipients may apply for CalFresh Food benefits, visit CalFreshFood.org

description:
Offers the following services:

  • Prenatal services - Obstetrics medical visits, postpartum care, health education, nutrition & behavioral health counseling, breastfeeding support, referrals to WIC
  • Family planning services - Contraception, fertility awareness methods, pregnancy testing and options counseling, preconception counseling
  • Reproductive health screening - Breast exams and referrals for mammograms, cervical cancer screenings and colposcopy, testing and treatment of sexually transmitted infections (STIs), urinary tract and vaginal infections
  • Mental health services - Medication Assisted Treatment (MAT) for substance use disorders, health Home Program for coordinating care to address chronic disease, HOPE Project, a mobile medical unit serving homeless patients, Homeless street medicine, where providers visit patients on foot to deliver care, relapse prevention for those recovering from substance use disorder, coping with Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD)

name: AIM (Access for Infants and Mothers) Program; Affordable Health Insurance for Pregnant Women
description: Provides low cost health insurance coverage to uninsured, middle income pregnant women. Total cost is 1.5% of the subscriber's adjusted annual household income. The State of California and the Federal Government supplement the subscriber contribution to cover the full cost of care. ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS: Pregnant 30 weeks or less as of application date; California resident; not a recipient of no-cost Medi-Cal or Medicare Part A and B as of application date; uninsured or covered by private insurance with a separate maternity deductible or co-payment of more than $500; and monthly household income within AIM guidelines. DOCUMENTS REQUIRED: Pregnancy certification; income verification documents and proof of income. APPLICATION DEADLINE INFORMATION: Complete application must be received by AIM Program prior to the end of 30th week of pregnancy in order to be considered for Program benefits. If near 30th week of pregnancy, applicant may send application overnight via Fed Ex, US Postal Service, or other means to: 625 Coolidge Drive, Suite 100, Folsom, CA 95630. Covers pregnant, middle income women until 60 days after delivery. Not a Medi-Cal program. In Alameda County, AIM Health Plans are available through ABC HMO, 1-800-327-0502, Monday-Friday, 7:30am-7pm. Plans could change within the year so call to confirm. Offers prenatal education program, screening and Perinatal Care Manager nurses. Includes multilingual customer service and also nurse advice line 24 hours daily. APPLICATIONS: PO Box 15559, Sacramento, CA 95852-0559. PAYMENTS: PO Box 15207, Sacramento, CA 95851-0207. OVERNIGHT APPLICATION ADDRESS: 625 Coolidge Drive, Suite 100, Folsom, CA 95630.

name: California Children's Services (CCS)
organization_name: ALAMEDA COUNTY PUBLIC HEALTH DEPARTMENT (ACPHD) FAMILY HEALTH SERVICES (FHS)
description:
Note: Operating through the phone only. Office is closed to the public. Posted: 4-28-2020 11:33pm SMR 

Program provides case management and financial assistance for medical treatment for children with serious, chronic and/or physically disabling medical conditions requiring special care. In addition, CCS provides physical and occupational therapy services to eligible children. There is no income requirement for physical and occupational therapy services.

name: California Managed Risk Medical Insurance Support Services
description: Provides health insurance for Californians unable to obtain coverage in the individual health insurance market Californians qualifying for the program participate in the cost of their coverage by paying premiums. The State of California supplements those premiums to cover the cost of care in the MRMIP. Application and Handbook available online and by phone. ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS: Must be a California resident; cannot be eligible for Medicare Part A and B unless solely because of end-stage renal disease; cannot be eligible to purchase any health insurance for continuation of benefits under COBRA or Cal-COBRA; and has been unable to secure adequate coverage within the previous 12 months. View website for more details.

name: Dental Health
organization_name: ALAMEDA COUNTY PUBLIC HEALTH DEPARTMENT (ACPHD) COMMUNITY HEALTH SERVICES
description: Administers four programs that address the dental and oral health needs of Alameda County residents, particularly children: HEALTH SMILES CHILDREN'S DENTAL PROGRAM: Dental treatment and insurance enrollment program for Alameda County children age 19 and under. HEALTHY KIDS, HEALTHY TEETH: Education and outreach to reduce prevalence of childhood cavities.

name: Dental Services - Check website or call for Lottery Dates
organization_name: BERKELEY COMMUNITY HEALTH PROJECT - BERKELEY FREE CLINIC
description:
Notes: Due to shelter in place all in person viists have been suspended. Call for more information or to speak to someone. Posted: 4-16-2020 9:55am SMR 

New patients, refer to the new client intake system, known as dental lottery. Call or check website under "Dental" for lottery dates. Lottery winners will receive an initial exam the same night. Services provided: dental examination and check-ups, dental cleanings, x-ray services, fillings, plastic/composite, metal/amalgam and simple extractions.

name: Eastmont Wellness Center
description: Provides orthopedic care, dermatology and ophthalmology services, and other specialized care. Its 16 examination rooms include a multi-use clinic and orthopedic cast room. Eastmont also provides pediatric and adult dentistry. Other offerings include adult primary care, pediatrics, medical counseling, immunizations, lab work, radiology, digital retinal screening, TB screening, podiatry and nutrition services.  Eastmont Wellness offers essential womens health services including gynecology, mammograms and family planning. Obstetric and prenatal care includes lab tests, health evaluations, physical exams and nutritional guidance, with caregiver teams made up of a midwife, doctor, social worker, nutritionist and health educator. Prenatal classes and entering services (such as learning care skills and mother support networks) in group and individual care settings are also available.

name: General Medical Services
organization_name: BERKELEY COMMUNITY HEALTH PROJECT - BERKELEY FREE CLINIC
description:
Notes: Due to shelter in place all in person viists have been suspended. Call for more information or to speak to someone. Posted: 4-16-2020 9:55am SMR 

Community -trained healthcare workers provide all medical services. Services include: Cough, colds; STI testing & treatment, women's STI testing for those without any current symptoms, Urinary Tract Infections (UTIs), simple rashes and skin concerns, minor wounds & burns (no sutures), TB testing, pregnancy testing, Tetanus, Boosters, foot fungus care. Clients are seen by appointment only. If homeless, call at 5:30 PM to make a same-evening appointment. For all other clients, call at 5:45 PM to arrange a same-evening appointment.  Clinic is open for general medical services in the evenings Monday thru Friday. Please note that the only Medical Service offered on the first Tuesday is Tuberculosis (TB) Testing. General medical services will be provided on all other weeknights (including TB testing).

name: Highland Campus: Dental Clinic
description:
Provides Emergency Dentistry (temporary fillings, repair of crowns and bridges, palliative emergency treatment, pulpotomy); Emergency Oral Surgery (for injuries and painful infections requiring immediate care); Diagnostic/ Preventive Care (exam, x-rays, fluoride topical applications, sealants, cleanings and hygiene oral care); Restorative Procedure (fillings, removable and fixed prosthetics, root canals and periodontal maintenance); Special Needs Dental Care (for individuals with developmental disabilities). Offers a walk in service for urgent care. Persons needing urgent care should register before 6:30am.

Also Highland has same day emergency appointments, but you cannot drop in, you have to call 510-437-6575.

name: Home Healthcare Supplies
description:
Note: All Operations have closed until further notice. Posted 4-15-2020 11:20am SMR 

Provides home health care equipment and supplies for people without medical insurance or whose medical insurance does not cover the cost of home medical supplies. Available equipment and supplies may include but is not limited to canes, walkers, ostomy supplies, gauze bandages, crutches, portable commodes, blood pressure kits, oxygen equipment, feeding kits and tubing, tub transfer benches, tub seats, tub stools and wheelchairs. Agency welcomes volunteers and accepts donations of reusable or unopened equipment.

name: HOPE Project (Mobile Health Clinic)
description:
NOTE: Temporary changes in Mobile Clinic schedule. 
Tuesday - 3:30 to 6 pm at Centerville Presbyterian Church, 4360 Central Avenue, Fremont (shower and dinner); Wednesday - 8 to 10 am at Irvington Presbyterian Church, 4181 Irvington Avenue, Fremont; Thursday - 3:30 - 6 pm at Centreville Presbyterian Church, 4360 Central Avenue, Fremont (shower).  Tri- City Health Center (TCHC) will not be accompanying the MC outside of Fremont locations during this period to reallocate to their current needs as an agency during this crisis. Due to this, we will not be bringing the mobile clinic to any sites except those listed above. We are currently out in the field with medical staff from TCH on Monday afternoons as well but in a different capacity. We will also no longer be bring the MC to Castro Valley on Thursday mornings however, our outreach staff will be there for an hour of that time to ensure some stability. 
Posted: 4/2/2020, 10:52 AM, ar
Engages homeless people through street outreach and through the HOPE Project Mobile Health Clinic. HOPE schedule and a fuller description of services can be found at www.abodeservices.org/about/need_assistance. People that are homeless (living on the street / outdoors, in a shelter, in a car, or in a place not fit for human habitation) can receive services. These include primary and mental health care; information and referrals to local resources (including substance abuse recovery, eye and dental appointments, and legal services); and assistance with preparing job and housing applications, acquiring benefits, and maintain health and hygiene.

name: Member Services
description: Member Services Department was developed because many patients come to Lifelong Medical Care uninsured and are unaware that they are eligible for low- to no-cost medical, vision and dental coverage programs. These programs include Family PACT, CARE, AIM, CMSP, and/or insurances such as Medi-cal, Medicare, Senior HMO's, Healthy Families, Healthy Kids, and Group Care. Member Services Department ensures health services coverage for as many patients as possible and assists people in knowing about these and other programs.

NOTE: You can also visit http://FoodNow.net for an online directory of food distribution sites near you.
Posted: 4/17/2020, 12:23 PM, ar
NOTE: Alameda County Food Bank - New pick up location below:
7195 Oak Port St, Oakland, CA
Monday-Wednesday-Friday 9am - 3pm
This is a drive thru pickup center.  We ask that you do not roll down your windows and that you stay inside your vehicle to maintain the CVOID-19 protocol.
Food will be placed inside your vehicle’s trunk.  For more info; call the Helpline at 510 635-3663

Posted: 4/6/2020, 2:07 PM, ar

Provides food assistance through member agencies who obtain food from the Food Bank and serve meals or provide food bags to local residents in need. The Food Bank also educates the community and public officials about the causes of hunger and poverty.

Also operates a website called Food Now, at http://foodnow.net/ for referral to weekend and after-hours food sites. People can click a button called I Need Food Today and search by full address, city or zip code. This same link in Spanish is: http://comidaahora.net/.

Also offers referrals and application assistance toward food programs such as Food Stamps, School Meals and WIC (Women, Infants and Children).

NOTE: Expansion of CalFresh to SSI/SSP Recipients!
Beginning June 1, 2019, recipients of SSI/SSP benefits may be eligible for CalFresh Food benefits for the first time! There is no change to the SSI/SSP monthly benefit. To learn about this policy change, and information on how SSI recipients may apply for CalFresh Food benefits, visit CalFreshFood.org

name: Women's Services
organization_name: BAY AREA COMMUNITY HEALTH (FORMERLY TRI-CITY HEALTH)
description:
Offers the following services:
  • Women's primary care - Family Planning, Pediatrics and Teen Clinic, Podiatry, and Chiropractic, Screenings
  • Prenatal services - Obstetrics medical visits, postpartum care, health education, nutrition & behavioral health counseling, breastfeeding support, referrals to WIC
  • Family planning services - Contraception, fertility awareness methods, pregnancy testing and options counseling, preconception counseling
  • Reproductive health screening - Breast exams and referrals for mammograms, cervical cancer screenings and colposcopy, testing and treatment of sexually transmitted infections (STIs), urinary tract and vaginal infections
  • Mental health services - Medication Assisted Treatment (MAT) for substance use disorders, health Home Program for coordinating care to address chronic disease, HOPE Project, a mobile medical unit serving homeless patients, Homeless street medicine, where providers visit patients on foot to deliver care, relapse prevention for those recovering from substance use disorder, coping with Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD)

name: CalFresh
organization_name: ALAMEDA COUNTY SOCIAL SERVICES AGENCY WORKFORCE AND BENEFITS ADMINISTRATION
description:
Note: Pandemic EBT. Pandemic EBT (P-EBT) benefits will be available for eligible California families. Due to Coronavirus (COVID-19), children who are eligible for free or reduced-price meals at school will get extra food benefits.
  • Families with children eligible for Free or Reduced meals that do not receive a P-EBT in the mail.
  •  Families should look out for a message from their school district or local community-based organization (us) about how to apply.
  • Eligible families can apply for P-EBT here: https://ca.p-ebt.org/
    • Eligible families can access the P-EBT information page here beginning now: https://ca.p-ebt.org/info
  • The P-EBT benefit amount is equal to the daily federal reimbursement rate for free breakfast and lunch multiplied by the average number of days schools were closed each month for each eligible child. California has been approved to provide benefits for all school days from March 16th through July 31st, 2020. Based on the federal per diem reimbursement for free breakfast of $2.20 and lunch of $3.50, the daily P-EBT benefit will be $5.70.
  • Online Application Closes: July 15, 2020
**P-EBT is not the same as or a replacement for CalFresh benefits. P-EBT is a separate food benefit that will be provided to eligible CalFresh and non-CalFresh households with children who may have temporarily lost access to FRP meals. P-EBT will have no bearing on CalFresh eligibility.**
Posted: 5-1-2020 3:04pm SMR. Updated 7-14-2020 8:58am SMR

NOTE:
If you have a change in income, even a temporary one because of the coronavirus, you can apply for CalFresh food benefits.
To apply, visit CalFresh online or call 1-877-847-3663 (1-877-847-FOOD).
Beginning April 28, people getting CalFresh food benefits can use their EBT card to buy groceries online at Amazon and Walmart statewide. See frequently asked questions about using EBT online.
Posted 4/28/2020, 5:00 PM, pg

NOTE:  COVID-19 Emergency Allotment (EA) for CalFresh households
 Amount of EA will vary by household and possibly by month to bring the total household benefit amount to the maximum benefit amount allowed under program regulations
Households already receiving the maximum benefit amount will NOT be eligible for the EA
Two EA scheduled for April 11, 2020, for eligible households that received CalFresh in March and May 10, 2020, for eligible households that received CalFresh in April
EA will be automatically loaded to EBT accounts if eligible
New applicants encouraged to submit their application as soon as possible to qualify for May 10, 2020, EA
Semi-Annual (SAR 7) or Annual Recertification/Redetermination due in March, April, or May 2020 will NOT be required at this time.
Interviews for these months will NOT be required
Benefits will continue uninterrupted
Changes in income can increase benefits
Contact Alameda County Social Services Agency to report changes

If qualified, applicants will receive benefits within 30 days from the date the application is received by the county through an EBT card . EBT consumers are not to be charged for shopping bags in grocery stores.

Come in/find an office
at CalFreshFood.org

NOTE: Temporary changes in Mobile Clinic schedule.

name: Mother Teresa Fund - Funeral and Cemetery Assistance Program
description:
Notes: Have to call to make an appointment. Limited amount of people are allowed in. Posted; 4-15-2020 4:12pm SMR 

Provides cemetery and funeral assistance to individuals that would otherwise be unable to afford proper services. Fund were established to serve very low income individuals as well as victims of violent crime. Services must be provided through the network of Catholic Funeral and Cemetery Services. Offers two levels of assistance: INDIGENT SERVICES (aka HOLY ANGELS REMEMBRANCE) PROGRAM is for individuals that are without resources and unable to make any payment for funeral, mortuary or interment services. Provides free cremation, interment and prayer service through CFCS mortuaries and cemeteries, in accordance with the Order of Christian Funerals. Cremated remains are interred in Holy Angels Remembrance Crypt at selected CFCS cemeteries. Indigent Services Program does not include burial services. FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE is for individuals that need extended payment terms for traditional burial or cremation, interment and funeral services. Requires reference from a pastor or someone that can vouch for the client. Recipients do not need to be Catholic. Fund serves individuals in need regardless of religious affiliation.

name: Veterans Service Office (VSO)
organization_name: ALAMEDA COUNTY SOCIAL SERVICES AGENCY DEPARTMENT OF ADULT AND AGING SERVICES
description:
Provides veterans and their dependents and/or survivors with information regarding veterans benefits. Offers assistance with filing:
  • benefit claims
  • waivers and appeals in order for them to obtain and maintain all available benefits and entitlements for which they are eligible

Administers the federal VETERANS RETRAINING ASSISTANCE PROGRAM (VRAP), which offers up to 12 months of training assistance to unemployed veterans. Participants must be enrolled in a VA approved program of education offered by a community college or technical school. Program must lead to an Associate Degree, Non-College Degree, or a Certificate, and train the Veteran for a high demand occupation.

name: Military Assistance Program
description:
Program provided to members of the military and their families include:
  • casework and assistance
  • counseling
  • assistance with government benefits
  • temporary emergency financial assistance
  • referrals to community and military resources

name: Oakland Regional Office - Veterans Benefits Services
description:
Helps veterans, their family members, and active duty service members connect to state and federal benefits. Benefits include:
  • Disability compensation
  • Pension
  • Housing
  • Health
  • Education (including dependents' college fee waiver)
  • farm and home loans
  • other benefits

name: Supportive Services for Veteran Families (SSVF)
description:
Note: Hours of operation have changed. Now only open Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays from 1pm to 4pm. Posted: 4-13-2020 10:07am SMR.

Provides low income homeless veterans with help in locating and securing permanent affordable housing. Services include:
  • short term case management
  • assessment
  • eligibility screening
  • rental, eviction and utility prevention services
  • money management services
  • legal services in the areas of Veteran disability benefits, and discharge upgrades
  • temporary funds assistance

SSVF Referral This program provides short-term financial assistance and housing navigation for eligible homeless veterans. It is administered by local non-profit agencies, not the VA. This referral is NOT a guarantee of financial assistance. It is a referral for screening, and the provider will work with veteran to obtain the paperwork needed for enrollment in the program.

name: Swords to Plowshares Supportive Services
description:
Note: Hours of operation have changed. Now only open Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays from 1pm to 4pm. Posted: 4-13-2020 10:07am SMR.

Helps veterans, as well as families of veterans, in the following areas: 

HEALTH AND SOCIAL SERVICES Provides veterans with the help they need to become self-sufficient.

SUPPORTIVE HOUSING Offers options for counseling, academic instruction, and vocational training for formerly homeless veterans with disabilities. Provides transitional housing program for 75 veterans at a time. Program offers intensive individual, group and peer counseling.

EMPLOYMENT SUPPORT Helps veterans become ready for employment. Also helps veterans transition to gainful employment through:
  • Vocational counseling
  • Job training
  • Resume preparation
  • Job referrals
LEGAL SERVICES Provides free legal representation, case management and advocacy to veterans seeking benefits. Provides free legal assistance with VA claims and discharge upgrades to Bay Area residents. Offers weekly open office hours during which veterans can receive advice from attorneys on their claims.

Procedures for leaving a message: If a client did not pick up the phone, or if information otherwise needs to be relayed without the client present, the HRC should leave a message stating that:
  1. The client may be eligible for SSVF
  2. An SSVF provider will follow up with the client using the same contact info that the HRC has
  3. They can contact the SSVF provider using the contact information below
  4. They can decline the offer of SSVF by contacting the HRC, or through the SSVF provider once the SSVF provider reaches out to them

description:
6/16/2020 - Offering bag of groceries to all veterans, their families and their social workers.  Limit of one bag a week.  Call ahead to make a reservation and arrange for pick up.  Posted 6/16/2020, 9:50 AM, pg

Currently keeping bags of non-perishables from the pantry in the government vehicle, making them mobile pantries.

The hotline assists homeless veterans, their families and service providers. Services are free and confidential. Provides information about local VA homeless programs and mental health services in the caller's area.

name: Self-assessment and Interactive Exercises Programs
description: Offers free, anonymous depression and alcohol use self-assessments to military service personnel and their families. Self-assessments are available online and by phone. Designed to help individuals identify their symptoms and gain referrals to assistance before a problem becomes serious.Also offers educational information designed for service members and their families, including videos and articles on topics including Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder, Dealing with Alcohol, and Being the Spouse Left Behind.

name: Veterans Service Office (VSO)
organization_name: ALAMEDA COUNTY SOCIAL SERVICES AGENCY DEPARTMENT OF ADULT AND AGING SERVICES
description:
Provides veterans and their dependents and/or survivors with information regarding veterans benefits. Offers assistance with filing:
  • benefit claims
  • waivers and appeals in order for them to obtain and maintain all available benefits and entitlements for which they are eligible

Administers the federal VETERANS RETRAINING ASSISTANCE PROGRAM (VRAP), which offers up to 12 months of training assistance to unemployed veterans. Participants must be enrolled in a VA approved program of education offered by a community college or technical school. Program must lead to an Associate Degree, Non-College Degree, or a Certificate, and train the Veteran for a high demand occupation.

name: Military OneSource Supportive Services
description:
Offers supportive services to military personnel and family members. Programs include:
  • Mental Health & Financial Counseling
  • Spouse Education & Career
  • Parenting
  • Elder Care
  • Finances
  • Health & Relationships
  • Crisis & Disaster
  • Emotional Well-being
  • Health Coaching Program
  • Short-term Solution focused Counseling (online, telephonic and face to face)

Program provides services and support to:
  • Active, Guard & Reserve Army, Navy, Marine, Air Force
  • immediate family members

name: Self-assessment and Interactive Exercises Programs
description: Offers free, anonymous depression and alcohol use self-assessments to military service personnel and their families. Self-assessments are available online and by phone. name: CAL FIRE Veteran Recruitment
organization_name: CALIFORNIA DEPARTMENT OF FORESTRY AND FIRE PROTECTION (CAL FIRE)
description: Offers employment related to forestry and fire. Includes full-time, seasonal, or temporary work. Offers health benefits and opportunities to work in various locations throughout the state.

name: Career Development and Economic Empowerment Program (CDEEP) & Alumni Program
description: Offers a 7 week workshop that educates and enriches the lives of women and men who are victims of violence and human trafficking, unemployed, veterans, disabled, formerly incarcerated, homeless or living in shelters; contributing to their overall well-being and helping them gain, maintain, and advance in employment that lead to wellness and recovery,  as well as full self-sufficiency. Infuses career development training with esteem building through their "Speak to the Heart from the Heart” model workshop. The workshop culminates in a formal graduation ceremony and concludes with an exclusive job fair where participants can apply what they’ve learned through their system, as well as a follow-up alumni program.

name: Employment Services - Homeless Veterans Reintigration Program (HVRP)
description: Offers personal assistance with job-readiness skills and pre-employment activities, including employer engagement and potential funding for short-term training activities. Provides assistance addressing barriers to work such as transportation, background checks, special clothing, and referrals to other service providers as needed.

name: Oakland Employment and Training (Veteran)
description:
Note: Hours of operation have changed. Now only open Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays from 1pm to 4pm. Posted: 4-13-2020 10:07am SMR.

Helps veterans reenter the workforce through direct training and job referrals. Offers a series of workshops designed to engage women veterans with career advancement opportunities and to create connections among women veteran professionals.  Call the office for more information about the workshops.

name: Swords to Plowshares Supportive Services
description:
Note: Hours of operation have changed. Now only open Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays from 1pm to 4pm. Posted: 4-13-2020 10:07am SMR.

Helps veterans, as well as families of veterans, in the following areas: 

HEALTH AND SOCIAL SERVICES Provides veterans with the help they need to become self-sufficient.

SUPPORTIVE HOUSING Offers options for counseling, academic instruction, and vocational training for formerly homeless veterans with disabilities. Provides transitional housing program for 75 veterans at a time. Program offers intensive individual, group and peer counseling.

EMPLOYMENT SUPPORT Helps veterans become ready for employment. Also helps veterans transition to gainful employment through:
  • Vocational counseling
  • Job training
  • Resume preparation
  • Job referrals
LEGAL SERVICES Provides free legal representation, case management and advocacy to veterans seeking benefits. Provides free legal assistance with VA claims and discharge upgrades to Bay Area residents. Offers weekly open office hours during which veterans can receive advice from attorneys on their claims.

name: Veteran Employment-Related Assistance Program (VEAP)
description: Offers tuition-free 4-6 month job training and placement assistance programs to veterans discharged under conditions other than dishonorable (see Eligibility Requirements for further details). Includes Unemployment Insurance (UI) approved training. Morning, afternoon and evening classes available.  Job training and placement programs include: Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint).

name: Veterans Service Office (VSO)
organization_name: ALAMEDA COUNTY SOCIAL SERVICES AGENCY DEPARTMENT OF ADULT AND AGING SERVICES
description:
Provides veterans and their dependents and/or survivors with information regarding veterans benefits. Offers assistance with filing:
  • benefit claims
  • waivers and appeals in order for them to obtain and maintain all available benefits and entitlements for which they are eligible

Administers the federal VETERANS RETRAINING ASSISTANCE PROGRAM (VRAP), which offers up to 12 months of training assistance to unemployed veterans. Participants must be enrolled in a VA approved program of education offered by a community college or technical school. Program must lead to an Associate Degree, Non-College Degree, or a Certificate, and train the Veteran for a high demand occupation.

name: Veterans Services
organization_name: CALIFORNIA STATE EMPLOYMENT DEVELOPMENT DEPARTMENT - EDD
description: Assists veterans and their eligible spouses maximize their employment and training opportunities. EDD veterans' representatives specialist in assisting veterans in their efforts to return to work. Located in local EDD offices Americas Job Centers of California including Fremont and Oakland. Provides 24-hour priority hold on all job listings. CustomizeD job search assistance, job fairs, employer recruitment and other events and resources. Veterans are encouraged to schedule an appointment with an EDD veterans' representative for personalized services and assistance to achieve professional goals.

name: Workforce Training Institute
description: Provides job training and placement services for low to moderate income individuals. Targets individuals in need of computer training.  CLASSES and TRAINING in: Microsoft Word, Excel, Access, Powerpoint.  JOB PREPARATION services include: assistance with: resume preparation, Internet access, online job search, pre-employment test preparation, and application submission.  JOB READINESS CERTIFICATION includes: enrollment into One-Stop Career Center services; completion of resume; obtaining an e-mail account; establishment of an EDD CalJob account; completion of a "job search portfolio" (cover letter, thank you letter/card, master application); and completion of job training (where applicable).

name: Crossroads Emergency Shelter
description:
Note: Not doing walk ins until futher notice. Only accepting referrals made by 211. Posted: 4-10-2020 4:39pm SMR 

Assists homeless families, veterans, and people living with HIV/AIDS recover from homelessness and achieve self-reliance and independence.
Note: HIV/AIDS Shelter Beds must be referred to AHIP Dept for assistance
Services also provide other special programs when available GA, CHASS, BHC and VA. Continuum of care services include: case management, life skills training, access to medical and dental care, mental health and substance abuse counseling, income and housing referrals, and career counseling. Single residents share dorm rooms during stay. Families live in a separate residential wing that holds five rooms (each with a private bathroom), a learning center, a play area and shared area for socializing. Also provides showers, laundry facilities, lockers, computers and Internet access.

name: Homeless Veteran Outreach
description:
Schedules visits to VA clinics and homeless shelters to assist homeless veterans in:
  • filing claims
  • assists to ensure that claims are expedited
  • follows up on the claims made

name: Oakland Behavioral Health (OBH) Clinic - VASH
description:
Provides a full range of mental health and substance abuse evaluation and treatment services. Offers trained and expert staff composed of:
  • psychiatrists
  • psychologists
  • social workers
  • occupational therapists
  • nurses
  • addiction/rehabilitation therapists
Offers opioid replacement program which opens at 6am. Also manages a Homeless Outreach Program and a Compensated Work Therapy Program. Services include:
  • Mental health services
  • substance abuse services
  • Homeless outreach

name: Roads Home - Supportive Services for Veterans Families (SSVF) - Oakland
description:
Provides supportive services to veteran households, working to help end homelessness among veterans and their families. Offers Veteran families with housing stability through obtaining or maintaining permanent housing, temporary rental assistance, or rapid re-housing. Additional support through peer outreach and internships, wraparound case management, links to healthcare and VA benefits assistance, and employment services.

Transitional Housing Program offers temporary housing (6-24 months) and intensive life skills training.

name: Supportive Services for Veterans Families SSVF - East Oakland Community Project
description:
Note: Not doing walk ins until futher notice. Only accepting referrals made by 211. Posted: 4-10-2020 4:39pm SMR 

SSVF Rapid Re-Housing provides housing navigation and temporary financial assistance for eligible homeless veterans and their families.

SSVF Referral: This program provides short-term financial assistance and housing navigation for eligible homeless veterans. It is administered by local non-profit agencies, not the VA. This referral is NOT a guarantee of financial assistance. It is a referral for screening, and the provider will work with you to obtain the paperwork needed for enrollment in the program.

name: Veteran Shelter and Housing
description:
Note: Outreach teams are in the field for hours each weekday, providing every unsheltered person they can find with information about the risks of COVID-19, prevention steps, and what to do if they feel sick. They are also distributing cleaning supplies, food, and other items to ensure that encampment residents can eat and care for themselves. On-site case managers of shelter and transitional housing have worked to educate residents on COVID-19 and the shelter-in-place rules; calmed people who are stressed and anxious; and ensured a continuous supply of food, hygiene supplies, and other basic needs, so residents did not have to leave the shelter. 

NOTE: Hours of Operation: 8:00 AM - 4:00 PM, Closed from 12:00 PM - 1:00 PM

Provides shelter, transitional housing, and permanent supportive housing services to help veterans and their families escape the crisis of homelessness and regain stability. Other services include:
  • ​Meals
  • Anger Management 
  • Credit Repair/Money Management Classes
  • On-site Alcohol Anonymous Meetings
  • Job Search Assistance
  • Veteran Benefits (Medical and Mental Health Services)

description:

  • casework and assistance
  • counseling
  • assistance with government benefits
  • temporary emergency financial assistance
  • referrals to community and military resources

name: Oakland Regional Office - Veterans Benefits Services
description:
Helps veterans, their family members, and active duty service members connect to state and federal benefits. Benefits include:
  • Disability compensation
  • Pension
  • Housing
  • Health
  • Education (including dependents' college fee waiver)
  • farm and home loans
  • other benefits

name: Supportive Services for Veteran Families (SSVF)
description:
Note: Hours of operation have changed. Now only open Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays from 1pm to 4pm. Posted: 4-13-2020 10:07am SMR.

Provides low income homeless veterans with help in locating and securing permanent affordable housing. Services include:
  • short term case management
  • assessment
  • eligibility screening
  • rental, eviction and utility prevention services
  • money management services
  • legal services in the areas of Veteran disability benefits, and discharge upgrades
  • temporary funds assistance

name: Oakland Outpatient Clinic
description:

  • medications
  • x-ray
  • laboratory
  • social work services
  • flu shots
  • hypertension screening
  • podiatry
  • eye exams
  • Mental Health Services
  • Alcohol and Drug Abuse Program
  • Senior Veterans Program

name: VA Palo Alto Health Care System (VAPAHCS) - Livermore Division
description:
Provides medical health care to eligible veterans. Services include:
  • extended care unit
  • medical ward for the sub-acutely ill
  • mental health clinic
  • neurology clinic
  • podiatry clinic
A dental clinic is available to veterans that meet specific eligibility requirements. Does not perform surgery or have emergency services.

name: VA Palo Alto Health Care System (VAPHCS) - Palo Alto
description: Offers a Veterans hospital and medical clinic in Palo Alto. Provides inpatient and outpatient medical, surgical and psychiatric care for eligible veterans.
